Catholic Iberians weren't slow to realize the potency of these warriors and as a result moved to copy the tactics of the hard tribesmen with their own Jinettes.

SED+EMF: Lightly-armored irregulars gather here in hopes of joining up with an army that can feed them more than brigandage can. Skilled with raiding the enemy with arrows and javelins, these unscrupulous ruffians can be a terror to an unsuspecting enemy.
EMF: Lightly-armored irregulars gather here in hopes of joining up with an army that can feed them more than brigandage can. Skilled with raiding the enemy with arrows and javelins, these unscrupulous ruffians can be a terror to an unsuspecting enemy.
SWMH: Almoghavars are a hardy bunch. Lightly armored but unrelenting, these mercenaries are a force to be respected.
SED: Almoghavars are a hardy bunch. Lightly armored but unrelenting, these mercenaries are a force to be respected.

EMF: The Syrian tradition of training eagle-eyed archers is kept alive here, stretching back even to antiquity when these warriors served as auxiliaries in Roman legions.

From the East they came, ruthless and without mercy: strange men, dressed in exotic armor and speaking in guttural tongues that none understood. Rumors carried across the Silk Road and the Indian Ocean have told of how Genghis Khan and his invincible Mongol hordes shattered the greatest empires of the known world, from Cathay to Persia. Though Genghis Khan is now dead, the sons and grandsons of Genghis intend to continue his conquests. They have their eyes upon Europe and the rest of the Middle East, and the entire world may be united under the banner of Genghis if his descendants do not end up fighting among themselves, that is. Perhaps the end of days has finally come at last, a punishment for the sins of the wicked or perhaps this is Gods greatest test yet for the faithful.

SED+EMF: With the breakup of the Sultanate of Rum and the decline of the Byzantine Empire, several warlords in Anatolia seek fame and glory in the ensuing power vacuum. Foremost among them is Osman, a pious and brave man. According to a dream he had many, many years ago, great things are in store for Osman and his dynasty. They might even conquer great Constantinople one day. But the journey to Constantinople wont be easy, and the Byzantine Empire, which has resisted attack after attack for almost a thousand years, will not go down without a fight.
EMF: With the breakup of the Sultanate of the Rum and the decline of the Byzantine Empire, several warlords in Anatolia seek fame and glory in the ensuing power vacuum. Foremost among them is Osman, a pious and brave man. According to a dream he had many, many years ago, great things are in store for Osman and his dynasty. They might even conquer great Constantinople one day. But the journey to Constantinople wont be easy, and the Byzantine Empire, which has resisted attack after attack for almost a thousand years, will not go down without a fight.

SED+EMF: For more than two centuries, the Khitan were the rightful rulers of northern China, perfectly balancing their traditional, nomadic way of life, and the urbane, sophisticated culture of their Chinese subjects. However, overthrown by their Jurchen vassals in the early years of the 12th century, remnants of the once-great Khitan have fled to Central Asia, where they seek to re-create their imperial splendor. Having just defeated the once-mighty Karakhanids and the Seljuks, the Khitan now have a foothold in the region. Will they continue their conquests, spreading their Sinicized nomadic culture and their Buddhist faith, or will they settle down, content with re-creating their Chinese empire in Central Asia? All that is certain is that the Khitan are not the first horde to appear suddenly from the far east, nor will they be the last.
EMF: For more than two centuries, the Khitan were the rightful rulers of northern China, perfectly balancing their traditional, nomadic way of life, and the urbane, sophisticated culture of their Chinese subjects. However, overthrown by their Jurchen vassals in the early years of the 12th century, remnants of the once-great Khitan have fled to Central Asia, where they seek to re-create their imperial splendor. Having just defeated the once-mighty Kara-Khanids and the Seljuks, the Khitan now have a foothold in the region. Will they continue their conquests, spreading their Sinicized nomadic culture and their Buddhist faith, or will they settle down, content with re-creating their Chinese empire in Central Asia? All that is certain is that the Khitan are not the first horde to appear suddenly from the far east, nor will they be the last.
Despot is the highest honorary title in the Byzantine Empire, second only to the Emperor. It can only be granted to close relatives, traditionally the oldest son.

SED+EMF: The decay and corruption within the imperial government has reduced its effectiveness at recruiting and maintaining a standing army.
EMF: The decay and corruption within the Imperial government has reduced its effectiveness at recruiting and maintaining a standing army.

For years, the Magyar clans have been torn apart by internal wars and strife. Many believe this has left the clans weakened, and while there is hope for eventual recovery, some believe it will be too late and that the clans are in a state which has left them weak to attack from neighbors.
AI bonus for nomad Lucky Rulers.

SWMH: Adoptionist
SED: Adoptionist

EMF: Adoptionists reject the Holy Trinity, believing that Jesus Christ was adopted as God's son at his ascension, chosen because of his sinless devotion to the will of God. They do not revere the Holy Mary, and were declared a Christian heresy at the end of the 2nd Century.
SWMH: Adoptionists reject the Holy Trinity, believing that Jesus Christ was adopted as God's son at his ascension, chosen because of his sinless devotion to the will of God. They do not revere the Holy Mary, and were declared a Christian heresy at the end of the 2nd Century.

SWMH: Apostolic
SED: Apostolic

SED+EMF: Sometimes referred to as Gregorian, this was one of the early Christian faiths, founded in Armenia by the Apostles Bartholomew and Thaddeus. It split from orthodox Christianity in the 6th century on a matter of Christology  they are miaphysite, believing Christ to be of one incarnate nature, where both divine and human nature are united.\n§Y*§! Learned Apostolics may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology
EMF: Sometimes referred to as 'Gregorian', this was one of the early Christian faiths founded in Armenia by the Apostles Bartholomew and Thaddeus. It split from orthodox Christianity in the 6th century as a matter of Christology -- they are miaphysite, believing Christ to be of one incarnate nature, where both divine and human nature are united.\n§Y*§! Learned Apostolics may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology

SWMH: Arian
SED: Arian

EMF: Arianism is a nontrinitarian belief that asserts that Jesus Christ is a Son of God, created by God the Father, distinct from the Father and therefore subordinate to the Father. It denies that Jesus is God the Son. The Ecumenical First Council of Nicaea of 325 AD deemed it to be a heresy.
SWMH: Arianism is a nontrinitarian belief that asserts that Jesus Christ is a Son of God, created by God the Father, distinct from the Father and therefore subordinate to the Father. It denies that Jesus is God the Son. The Ecumenical First Council of Nicaea of 325 AD deemed it to be a heresy.

SWMH: Haruri
SED: Haruri

EMF: The Haruri are a sect from the period of the Four Rightly-Guided Caliphs, named for their first leader, Habib ibn-Yazid al-Haruri. The Haruri were originally one branch of the Khariji 'Rejectors' movement, so called because they rejected Ali's right to the Caliphate.
SWMH: The Haruri are a sect from the period of the Four Rightly-Guided Caliphs, named for their first leader, Habib ibn-Yazid al-Haruri. The Haruri were originally one branch of the Khariji 'Rejectors' movement, so called because they rejected Ali's right to the Caliphate.
SED: The Haruri are a sect from the period of the Rashidun Caliphs, named for their first leader, Habib ibn-Yazid al-Haruri. The Haruri were originally one branch of the Kharijite Rejectors movement, so called because they rejected Alis right to the Caliphate.

SWMH: Isma'ili
SED: Ismaili

EMF: The Isma'ilis believe that, when the 6th Imam, Ja'far al-Sadiq died, his true successor was not Musa al-Kazim as the others believe, but in fact was the already dead Isma'il and his son Muhammad. The line of Isma'il has been in hiding for years, but now has emerged to reclaim the Caliphate.
SWMH: The Isma'ilis believe that, when the 6th Imam, Ja'far al-Sadiq died, his true successor was not Musa al-Kazim as the others believe, but in fact was the already dead Isma'il and his son Muhammad. The line of Isma'il has been in hiding for years, but now has emerged to reclaim the Caliphate.

SWMH: Mahdite
SED: Mahdist

EMF: The Mahdites believe that the messiah, or Mahdi, has already risen, and given his commandments that clarify the Qur'an such that no other interpretation is valid. They are led by their own Caliphate of successors to the Mahdi.
SWMH: The Mahdites believe that the messiah, or Mahdi, has already risen, and given his commandments that clarify the Qur'an such that no other interpretation is valid. They are led by their own Caliphate of successors to the Mahdi.
SED: The Mahdists believe that the messiah, or Mahdi, has already risen, and given his commandments that clarify the Quran such that no other interpretation is valid. They are led by their own Caliphate of successors to the Mahdi.

SWMH: Mandaean
SED: Mandaean

EMF: Mandaeism is a gnostic religion with a strongly dualistic worldview. Its adherents revere Adam, Abel, Seth, Enosh, Noah, Shem, Aram and especially John the Baptist, but reject Abraham, Moses and Jesus of Nazareth. It is represented in-game as an early form of Manichaeism, and a potential heresy should it resurface.
SWMH: Mandaeism is a gnostic religion with a strongly dualistic worldview. Its adherents revere Adam, Abel, Seth, Enosh, Noah, Shem, Aram and especially John the Baptist, but reject Abraham, Moses and Jesus of Nazareth. It is represented in-game as an early form of Manichaeism, and a potential heresy should it resurface.
SED: Mandaeism is a gnostic religion with a strongly dualistic worldview. Its adherents revere Adam, Abel, Seth, Enos, Noah, Shem, Aram and especially John the Baptist, but reject Abraham, Moses and Jesus of Nazareth. It is represented in-game as an early form of Manichaeism, and a potential heresy should it resurface.

SED+EMF:
Manichaeism is a Gnostic religion founded by the prophet Mani, who was put to death by the Sassanid Shahanshah Bahram I in 277. His Religion of Light incorporated elements of Christianity, Zoroastrianism, Buddhism and Gnosticism. At one point, Manichaeism spread far and wide, and was the biggest competitor with Christianity for replacing classical paganism until it began to fade in the 6th century. Features:
§Y*§! The Manichaean Archegos exists in the Old Gods and Charlemagne bookmarks, and may be restored later
§Y*§! Manichaeans have their own holy festival, the Bema Feast
§Y*§! Manichaeans may elect to dedicate themselves to a Shekhinah upon adulthood
EMF:
Manichaeism is a Gnostic religion founded by the prophet Mani, who was put to death by the Sassanid Shahanshah Bahram I in 277. His 'Religion of Light' incorporated elements of Christianity, Zoroastrianism, Buddhism and Gnosticism. At one point, Manichaeism spread far and wide, and was the biggest competitor with Christianity for replacing classical Paganism until it began to fade in the 6th century. Features:
§Y*§! The Manichaean Archegos exists in the Old Gods and Charlemagne bookmarks, and may be restored later
§Y*§! Manichaeans have their own holy festival, the Bema Feast
§Y*§! Manichaeans may elect to dedicate themselves to a Shekhinah upon adulthood

His 'Religion of Light' incorporated elements of Christianity, Zoroastrianism, Buddhism and Gnosticism. At one point, Manichaeism spread far and wide, and was the biggest competitor with Christianity for replacing classical Paganism until it began to fade in the 6th century.
SED: Manichaeism is a Gnostic religion founded by the prophet Mani, who was put to death by the Sassanid Shahanshah Bahram I in 277. His Religion of Light incorporated elements of Christianity, Zoroastrianism, Buddhism and Gnosticism. At one point, Manichaeism spread far and wide, and was the biggest competitor with Christianity for replacing classical paganism until it began to fade in the 6th century.
VANILLA: Manichaeism is a Gnostic religion founded by the alleged prophet Mani who was put to death by the Sassanid Shahanshah Bahram I in 277. His 'Religion of Light' incorporated elements of Christianity, Zoroastrianism, Buddhism and Gnosticism. In the game, Manichaeism is regarded as a Zoroastrian heresy. It has no formal head and no special game mechanics.

SWMH: Maronite
SED: Maronite

SED+EMF: Beginning as a movement founded by the monk Maron in the fourth century, the Maronites are a Christian Church in full communion with the Holy See yet under the leadership of the Maronite Patriarch.\n§Y*§! Learned Maronites may subscribe to either the Antiochian or Alexandrite schools of theology
EMF: Beginning as a movement founded by the monk Maron in the fourth century, the Maronites are a Christian Church in full communion with the Holy See yet under the leadership of the Maronite Primate.\n§Y*§! Learned Maronites may subscribe to either the Antiochian or Alexandrite schools of theology
SWMH: Beginning as a movement founded by the monk Maron in the fourth century, the Maronites are a Christian Church in full communion with the Holy See yet under the leadership of the Maronite Primate.
SED: Beginning as a movement founded by the monk Maron in the fourth century, the Maronites are a Christian Church in full communion with the Holy See yet under the leadership of the Maronite Patriarch.

SED+EMF:
The Messalians, or Euchites (those who pray), are a heretical Christian sect that originated in Mesopotamia, influenced by dualistic faiths like Zoroastrianism. Messalians believe that God can be perceived by the carnal senses, and that this perception is necessary to reach perfection. Each person is born with an inner demon, and only intense prayer can drive it out. They also believe that Lucifer is the elder son of God and a force for good, and that incest is sacred since it was practised by the children of Adam and Eve. They have no formal rites and no strict church hierarchy. Features:
§Y*§! Messalians must pray to expel their personal demons
§Y*§! Once the demons are driven out, they can achieve the status of Perfection
§Y*§! Learned Messalians may subscribe to the Antiochian school of theology
§Y*§! Messalians may choose a patron saint to worship
§Y*§! Messalians can create their own Holy Order, the Army of Lucifer
§Y*§! The Patriarch of Antioch will automatically become the new religion head

SWMH: Coptic
SED: Coptic

EMF: Copts are miaphysite, stressing that Christ had but a single nature, but of both human and divine character. This stance split them off from the main branch of Christianity after the council of Chalcedon in 451. Though not viewed as outright heretics by Orthodox and Catholic Christians, it is a fine distinction. The nominal head of the Coptic Church is the Pope of Alexandria.\n§Y*§! Copts may opt to become Desert Fathers and Desert Mothers instead of monks and nuns\n§Y*§! Learned Copts may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology
SWMH: Copts are miaphysite, stressing that Christ had but a single nature, but of both human and divine character. This stance split them off from the main branch of Christianity after the council of Chalcedon in 451. Though not viewed as outright heretics by Orthodox and Catholic Christians, it is a fine distinction. The nominal head of the Coptic Church is the Pope of Alexandria.
SED: Copts are miaphysite, stressing that Christ had but a single nature, but of both human and divine character. This stance split them off from the main branch of Christianity after the council of Chalcedon in 451. Though not viewed as outright heretics by Orthodox and Catholic Christians, it is a fine distinction. The nominal head of the Coptic Church is the Pope of Alexandria.
VANILLA: Miaphysite Christianity encompasses the Coptic Church and the Armenian Apostolic Church. Miaphysites stress that Christ had but a single nature, but of both human and divine character. This stance split them off from the main branch of Christianity after the council of Chalcedon in 451. Though not viewed as outright heretics by Orthodox and Catholic Christians, it is a fine distinction. The nominal head of the Miaphysite Church is the Pope of Alexandria.

SED+EMF: Monophysitism is an early Christian heresy which states that Christ had but a single nature. This is the opposite of the Nestorian position that Christ has two separate natures  one divine and one human. The nominal head of the Monophysite Church is the Monophysite Pope of Alexandria.\n§Y*§! Monophysites may opt to become Desert Fathers and Desert Mothers instead of monks and nuns\n§Y*§! Learned Monophysites may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology
EMF: Monophysitism is an early Christian heresy which states that Christ had but a single nature. This is the opposite of the Nestorian position where Christ has two separate natures - one divine and one human. The nominal head of the Monophysite Church is the Monophysite Pope of Alexandria.\n§Y*§! Monophysites may opt to become Desert Fathers and Desert Mothers instead of monks and nuns\n§Y*§! Learned Monophysites may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology
SWMH: Monophysitism is an early Christian heresy which states that Christ had but a single nature. This is the opposite of the Nestorian position where Christ has two separate natures - one divine and one human. The nominal head of the Monophysite Church is the Monophysite Pope of Alexandria.
SED: Monophysitism is an early Christian heresy which states that Christ had but a single nature. This is the opposite of the Nestorian position that Christ has two separate natures  one divine and one human. The nominal head of the Monophysite Church is the Monophysite Pope of Alexandria.
VANILLA: Monophysitism is an early Christian heresy which states that Christ had but a single nature. This is the opposite of the Nestorian position where Christ has two separate natures - one divine and one human. Closely related to Miaphytism, Monophysites are regarded as a Miaphysite heresy in-game. The nominal head of the Monophysite Church is the Monophysite Pope of Alexandria.

SWMH: Nabawite
SED: Nabawite

EMF: The Nabawites believe that the Qur'an was only the holy book for the Arabs, and that they have their own holy book and prophet, just as legitimate, sent by God for their people, modelled on Islam. They are led by a Malik, similar to the Muslim Caliph.
SWMH: The Nabawites believe that the Qur'an was only the holy book for the Arabs, and that they have their own holy book and prophet, just as legitimate, sent by God for their people, modelled on Islam. They are led by a Malik, similar to the Muslim Caliph.

EMF: Nestorianism is an early Christian branch which states that Christ has two separate natures - one divine and one human. This is the opposite of the Monophysite position where Christ has but a single nature. The nominal head of the Nestorian Church is the Patriarch of the East.\n§Y*§! Learned Nestorians may subscribe to the Antiochian school of theology

SED+EMF:
Paulicianism is a Christian Gnostic heresy influenced by Manichaeism, originating in Armenia, and known for its militarist attitude and emphasis on only accepting the New Testament as legitimate. Features:
§Y*§! May declare Holy War or Crusade on anyone of a different religion, even other Christians
§Y*§! May gain the Icon-Breaker trait after sieging a Christian temple
§Y*§! May expend Piety to raise units of zealots during a war
§Y*§! Learned Paulicians may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology

Paulicianism is Christian Gnostic heresy influenced by Manichaeism, originating in Armenia, and known for its militarist attitude and emphasis on only accepting the New Testament as legitimate. Features:
§Y*§! May declare Holy War or Crusade on anyone of a different religion, even other Christians
§Y*§! May gain the Icon-Breaker trait after sieging a Christian temple

§Y*§! Learned Paulicians may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology

SED: Paulicianism is a Christian Gnostic heresy influenced by Manichaeism, originating in Armenia, and known for its militarist attitude and emphasis on only accepting the New Testament as legitimate.
VANILLA: Paulicianism is Christian Gnostic heresy influenced by Manichaeism, originating in Armenia. In the game, it is treated as an Orthodox heresy.

SWMH: Qarmati
SED: Qarmatian

EMF: The Qarmatians are a extreme splinter sect of Isma'ili Islam, and believe that there are seven ages of man, each with a new religion and prophet, and the final age is approaching. They believe that the rest of the Isma'ilis have lost the faith, and that Muhammad son of Isma'il is still in hiding, waiting to return as the Mahdi.
SWMH: The Qarmatians are a extreme splinter sect of Isma'ili Islam, and believe that there are seven ages of man, each with a new religion and prophet, and the final age is approaching. They believe that the rest of the Isma'ilis have lost the faith, and that Muhammad son of Isma'il is still in hiding, waiting to return as the Mahdi.
SED: The Qarmatians are a extreme splinter sect of Ismaili Islam, and believe that there are seven ages of man, each with a new religion and prophet, and the final age is approaching. They believe that the rest of the Ismailis have lost the faith, and that Muhammad son of Ismail is still in hiding, waiting to return as the Mahdi.

SWMH: Tondrakian
SED: Tondrakian

SED+EMF: The Tondrakians are an anti-feudal, anti-church sect that originally flourished in Armenia between the 9th and 11th centuries. They denied the immortality of the soul, the afterlife, and the rights of the church to rule over its fellow man. They supported property rights for peasants and equality between men and women.\n§Y*§! Learned Tondrakians may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology

SWMH: Waqifite
SED: Waqifite

EMF: The Waqifi believe that the Imamate has ended before the main branch of Shi'ism has accepted it. To the Waqifi, the final Imam is the Mahdi who will return at the end of days, and they wait faithfully for him.
SWMH: The Waqifi believe that the Imamate has ended before the main branch of Shi'ism has accepted it. To the Waqifi, the final Imam is the Mahdi who will return at the end of days, and they wait faithfully for him.

SWMH: Zaydi
SED: Zaydi

EMF: The Zaydis are a Shi'a group that believe that the 'Alid Imams are not infallible, but are divinely inspired and have a responsibility to lead rebellion against corrupt authority.
SWMH: The Zaydis are a Shi'a group that believe that the 'Alid Imams are not infallible, but are divinely inspired and have a responsibility to lead rebellion against corrupt authority.
SED: The Zaydis are a Shia group that believe that the Alid Imams are not infallible, but are divinely inspired and have a responsibility to lead rebellion against corrupt authority.

SWMH: Zurvanist
SED: Zurvanite

EMF: Zurvanism is a branch of Zoroastrianism that believes in the existence of Zurvan, a genderless god of of infinite time (and space), for whom there is no distinction between good and evil. Zurvan is the parent of the two opposites representing the good god, Ahura Mazda, and the evil Angra Mainyu, unlike normal Zoroastrianism, where Ahura Mazda is the Supreme Being. Zurvanism is further divided by its three schools of thought: Aesthetic, Fatalistic and Materialistic.
SWMH: Zurvanism is a branch of Zoroastrianism that believes in the existence of Zurvan, a genderless god of of infinite time (and space), for whom there is no distinction between good and evil. Zurvan is the parent of the two opposites representing the good god, Ahura Mazda, and the evil Angra Mainyu, unlike normal Zoroastrianism, where Ahura Mazda is the Supreme Being. Zurvanism is further divided by its three schools of thought: Aesthetic, Fatalistic and Materialistic.
SED: Zurvanism is a branch of Zoroastrianism that believes in the existence of Zurvan, a sexless god of of infinite time (and space), for whom there is no distinction between good and evil. Zurvan is the parent of the two opposites representing the good god, Ahura Mazda, and the evil Angra Mainyu, unlike normal Zoroastrianism, for which Ahura Mazda is the supreme being. Zurvanism is further divided by its three schools of thought: Aesthetic, fatalistic and materialistic.

SWMH: Court Infighting
SED: Court Infighting

EMF: If a ruler's court grows out of his control, the results can be devastating. It's entirely possible for the empire to fly apart at the seams. Even if it doesn't, it will become increasingly difficult for the ruler to exert influence over members of his court -- or keep them within the empire after his death.

Even if it doesn't, it will become increasingly difficult for the ruler to exert influence over members of his court -- or keep them within the empire after his death.

Even if it doesnt, it will become increasingly difficult for the ruler to exert influence over members of his court  or keep them within the empire after his death.

SWMH: Faith Organization
SED: Faith Organization

EMF: In its inception, the Bogomilist faith was only loosely organized. It didn't believe in formal churches, and opposed any kind of formal hierarchy -- indeed, the hierarchy and tyranny of the Orthodox Church is partly what prompted its creation. Its anarchical nature also makes the faithful difficult to control with the traditional feudal structure. It is possible, however, for a powerful Bogomilist ruler to slowly organize and reform the faith into something permanent and lasting...but it will not be easy, and the common folk are likely to resist any such attempt.
SWMH: In its inception, the Bogomilist faith was only loosely organized. It didn't believe in formal churches, and opposed any kind of formal hierarchy -- indeed, the hierarchy and tyranny of the Orthodox Church is partly what prompted its creation. Its anarchical nature also makes the faithful difficult to control with the traditional feudal structure. It is possible, however, for a powerful Bogomilist ruler to slowly organize and reform the faith into something permanent and lasting...but it will not be easy, and the common folk are likely to resist any such attempt.
SED: In its inception, the Bogomil faith was only loosely organized. It didnt believe in formal churches, and opposed any kind of formal hierarchy  indeed, the hierarchy and tyranny of the Orthodox Church is partly what prompted its creation. Its anarchical nature also makes the faithful difficult to control with the traditional feudal structure. It is possible, however, for a powerful Bogomil ruler to slowly organize and reform the faith into something permanent and lasting but it will not be easy, and the common folk are likely to resist any such attempt.

SED: No Bogomil Organization

SWMH: Bogmilism Supported
SED: Bogomilism Supported

SWMH: Fraticelli Priesthood
SED: Fraticelli Priesthood

EMF: While all priests are initially monastic in nature, just as within the Catholic Church, the Fraticelli belief is that it is imperative for priests to take a more active role in the spreading of the faith and the operation of government. Thus a Fraticelli ruler is able to determine whether those ideals will be enforced.

SWMH: Wealth Sharing
SED: Wealth Sharing

EMF: One of Mazdak's primary teachings was that the Zoroastrian priesthood oppressed its people, and hoarded its wealth. He believed that wealth should be shared, and espoused ideas of egalitarianism that were way ahead of his time. A ruler of proper faith should, by the Mazdaki faith, set aside a large share of its taxes for the people -- and force his vassals to do the same.

A ruler of proper faith should, by the Mazdakite faith, set aside a large share of its taxes for the people  and force his vassals to do the same.

SWMH: Consolamentum
SED: Consolamentum

EMF: The only sacrament of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, the Consolamentum represented a purification of the faithful from sins gained throughout their life. Once the ritual baptism had occurred, the faithful [Root.Religion.GetName] would be considered 'Perfect' and be expected to live a life of celibacy -- as well as to spread the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith further. Most did not receive Consolamentum until their deathbeds, but the zealous would take the sacrament much earlier.

SWMH: Declare [Root.Religion.GetName] Emancipation
SED: Declare [Root.Religion.GetName] Emancipation

EMF: The [Root.Religion.GetName] faith is considered a heresy, but perhaps that need not be the case. With an officially-ordained head of our religion and a [Root.Religion.GetName] champion of sufficient esteem to sponsor a place for negotiations to take place, perhaps we could divorce ourselves from heresy and be treated as an offshoot from our parent religion instead...if they will let us go without a fight, that is. Doing so means giving up on any hope of supplanting them as the 'official' faith, but is that what we really want?

Doing so means giving up on any hope of supplanting them as the official faith, but is that what we really want?

SWMH: The Pact of Time
SED: The Pact of Time

EMF: The coming of age ceremony for all Druze adults, in it the Druze signs the Charter known as the Mithaq Walley El-Zaman -- the 'Pact of Time Custodian'. The Charter embodies all human souls after death, allowing for their reincarnation in the next life.

SWMH: Force Bogomilist Formalization
SED: Force Bogomil Formalization

EMF: A leader of enough piety and standing could force a formalization of the Bogomilist faith far more quickly than would otherwise be possible. This will mean any repercussions from the faithful will happen immediately, but so will the reforms.
SWMH: A leader of enough piety and standing could force a formalization of the Bogomilist faith far more quickly than would otherwise be possible. This will mean any repercussions from the faithful will happen immediately, but so will the reforms.

SWMH: Formalize the Bogomilist Faith
SED: Formalize the Bogomil Faith

EMF: Enough work has been done to organize the Bogomilist faith for it to now be considered to have a structure of its own. Note that this will mean that feudal lords will no longer be able to hold temples, and that temple holders will be considered Bogomilist bishops as elsewhere in Christendom.

SWMH: Search for Omens
SED: Search for Omens

EMF: Study the Holy Qur'an in search of hidden truths about the future. Beware, for the omens could be good or bad, and the resulting effect on your mind could be devastating.
SWMH: Study the Holy Qur'an in search of hidden truths about the future. Beware, for the omens could be good or bad, and the resulting effect on your mind could be devastating.

EMF: Study the Mysteries of the Qur'an
SWMH: Study the Mysteries of the Qur'an
SED: Study the Mysteries of the Quran

EMF: Scholarship and mysticism represent the highest levels of Muslim faith and achievement. A scholar should spend their life poring over the Qur'an, unlocking its secrets and advancing their understanding of the universe -- even if doing so represents possible hazards such as blindness, insanity, or worse. Such risk is the price one must pay for enlightenment.

Such risk is the price one must pay for enlightenment.

SWMH: Public Execution
SED: Public Execution

EMF: Publicly execute §Y[Root.GetBestName]§!. You will receive prestige and piety for doing so, based on their rank and relative importance. Note that, while you may execute close relatives, you will lose prestige for doing so (though you will still gain piety).

SWMH: Renounce Vows
SED: Renounce Vows

EMF: As a Lollard, you are beholden to neither vows of chastity nor vows of religious service -- you may freely renounce both and rejoin the layity.

SWMH: Revoke Religious Titles
SED: Revoke Religious Titles

SWMH: Translate the Bible
SED: Translate the Bible

EMF: One of the ways the Catholic Church maintains its dominance over the common man is by ensuring that almost nobody can read the Bible. Perhaps the time has come to take the scripture out of the hands of the few and put it into the hands of the masses by ordering a translation of the Bible into the vernacular. It would be an incredibly expensive proposition, and take years to complete, but it would be a terrible blow to Catholic authority.

SWMH: Choose a Shekhinah
SED: Choose a Shekhinah

EMF: A shekinah is the settling of the Divine Presence of God, representing a facet of Manichaen worship which a member of the faith chooses to focus upon.
SWMH: A shekinah is the settling of the Divine Presence of God, representing a facet of Manichaen worship which a member of the faith chooses to focus upon.

SWMH: Create Manichaen Archegos
SED: Create Manichaen Archegos

EMF: The Manichaen faith has been without a true leader for a long time. Now, with the fortunes of the faith having been restored due to your benevolent rule, it is time for a new Archegos to be raised up to lead the faithful into this brave new age.
SWMH: The Manichaen faith has been without a true leader for a long time. Now, with the fortunes of the faith having been restored due to your benevolent rule, it is time for a new Archegos to be raised up to lead the faithful into this brave new age.

SWMH: Patronize Art
SED: Patronize Art

EMF: Religious artwork is important to the Manichaean faith. Mani himself was known as 'the Artist', and Manichaean rulers would donate their wealth to support the creation of new artistic works.
SWMH: Religious artwork is important to the Manichaean faith. Mani himself was known as 'the Artist', and Manichaean rulers would donate their wealth to support the creation of new artistic works.
SED: Religious artwork is important to the Manichaean faith. Mani himself was known as the Artist, and Manichaean rulers would donate their wealth to support the creation of new artistic works.

SWMH: Create Mazdaki Priesthood
SED: Create Mazdakite Priesthood

EMF: While Mazdak railed against the oppression of the Zoroastrian priesthood, now that his teachings have spread across all of Persia perhaps the time has come to institue an organized priesthood of our own -- one that espouses the egalitarian principles upon which the Mazdaki faith is founded.

SWMH: Choose Mazdaki Power
SED: Choose Mazdaki Power

EMF: The Mazdaki teach there are four Powers that bring Light into the World: Discernment, Understanding, Preservation, and Joy. Any adult member of the faith may embrace one of these Powers. in an attempt to achieve eventual perfection.

SWMH: Abandon Prayers
SED: Abandon Prayers

EMF: The process of driving out one's demons is an exhausting process, perhaps even dangerous. While it would mean failure in the eyes of the Holy Spirit, perhaps it is best to put aside the prayers for a time and restore your strength before attempting them again.
SWMH: The process of driving out one's demons is an exhausting process, perhaps even dangerous. While it would mean failure in the eyes of the Holy Spirit, perhaps it is best to put aside the prayers for a time and restore your strength before attempting them again.

SWMH: Achieve Perfection
SED: Achieve Perfection

SED+EMF: To one of the Messalian faith, achieving perfection  meaning one is free of the demons who bring with them mortal sin  is the holiest state to which one can aspire. It means being one with God, and will make the Messalian a teacher of their fellow faithful. It also means that one is free of any obligations to mortal concepts of morality and constraint, as the idea of perfection is literal. If you are one with God, how can you possibly sin? To achieve perfection requires a long period of prayer and fasting, and even then may not result in success unless the Messalian is sufficiently pious and determined.
EMF: To one of the Messalian faith, achieving perfection -- meaning one is free of the demons who bring with them mortal sin -- is the holiest state to which one can aspire. It means being one with God, and will make the Messalian a teacher of their fellow faithful. To achieve perfection requires a long period of prayer and fasting, and even then may not result in success unless the Messalian is sufficiently pious and determined.

SWMH: Castrate Yourself
SED: Castrate Yourself

EMF: Follow in the path of the Saint Sabas Apokopos, one of the founders of the Messalian sect, and castrate yourself. In the eyes of the Messalian faith, it is one of the most holy acts a follower is capable of -- though naturally it can only be done once.

SWMH: Choose Patron Saint
SED: Choose Patron Saint

EMF: The Messalians believe that there are four important patron saints that watch over them: Saint Nestor, Saint Adelphius, Saint Addai, and -- perhaps most shocking to other Christians -- Lucifer the Lightbringer. It is important that a Messalian choose one of these patron saints to watch over them, and it will be the patron to whom they direct their daily prayers.

SWMH: Expel Daemons
SED: Expel Daemons

EMF: The Messalians believe that sins are literal demons that exist within the body, and that the only way to rid oneself of sin is to endure ritual fasting and rigorous prayer until the demons are forced out. This is the only way that one can achieve perfection and unity with God, after which point all of one's obligations to morality and piety are considered irrelevant.
SWMH: The Messalians believe that sins are literal demons that exist within the body, and that the only way to rid oneself of sin is to endure ritual fasting and rigorous prayer until the demons are forced out. This is the only way that one can achieve perfection and unity with God, after which point all of one's obligations to morality and piety are considered irrelevant.
SED: The Messalians believe that sins are literal demons that exist within the body, and that the only way to rid oneself of sin is to endure ritual fasting and rigorous prayer until the demons are forced out. This is the only way that one can achieve perfection and unity with God, after which point all of ones obligations to morality and piety are considered irrelevant.

SWMH: Join the Cult of Lucifer
SED: Join the Cult of Lucifer

EMF: A secret society among the Messalians that honors the Lightbringer as an agent of change. They seek to expose the secrets of Heaven and Hell, secrets they will keep for themselves. To most, however, it is a cult of machinations, where important secrets are exchanged amongst members for their own betterment.
SWMH: A secret society among the Messalians that honors the Lightbringer as an agent of change. They seek to expose the secrets of Heaven and Hell, secrets they will keep for themselves. To most, however, it is a cult of machinations, where important secrets are exchanged amongst members for their own betterment.

To most, however, it is a cult of machinations, where important secrets are exchanged amongst members for their own betterment.

SWMH: Become Desert [Root.GetFatherMother]
SED: Become Desert [Root.GetFatherMother]

EMF: Abdicate any titles you have and wander the desert as a religious ascetic -- becoming a Desert [Root.GetFatherMother] is a respected position amongst Coptics, and a tradition that has been ongoing since Saint Mark introduced Christianity to Egypt after the ascension of Christ.
SWMH: Abdicate any titles you have and wander the desert as a religious ascetic -- becoming a Desert [Root.GetFatherMother] is a respected position amongst Coptics, and a tradition that has been ongoing since Saint Mark introduced Christianity to Egypt after the ascension of Christ.
SED: Abdicate any titles you have and wander the desert as a religious ascetic -- becoming a Desert [Root.GetFatherMother] is a respected position amongst Coptics, and a tradition that has been ongoing since Saint Mark introduced Christianity to Egypt after the ascension of Christ.

SWMH: Embrace Alexandrine School
SED: Embrace Alexandrine School

EMF: Those of advanced learning in eastern churches tend to lean towards one of two schools of theology -- the Alexandrine School emphasizes the allergorical interpretation of scriptures, and tends to a more pragmatic approach towards the advancement of science and thought...even if that can lead to conflict with the zealous.
SWMH: Those of advanced learning in eastern churches tend to lean towards one of two schools of theology -- the Alexandrine School emphasizes the allergorical interpretation of scriptures, and tends to a more pragmatic approach towards the advancement of science and thought...even if that can lead to conflict with the zealous.
SED: Those of advanced learning in eastern churches tend to lean towards one of two schools of theology  the Alexandrine School emphasizes the allegorical interpretation of scriptures, and tends to a more pragmatic approach towards the advancement of science and thought even if that can lead to conflict with the zealous.

SWMH: Embrace Antiochian School
SED: Embrace Antiochian School

EMF: Those of advanced learning in eastern churches tend to lean towards one of two schools of theology -- The Antiochan School leans toward a more literal interpretation of scriptures, and focuses more on tradition and the advancement of culture...even if that can lead to conflict with those of a more cynical or progressive view.
SWMH: Those of advanced learning in eastern churches tend to lean towards one of two schools of theology -- The Antiochan School leans toward a more literal interpretation of scriptures, and focuses more on tradition and the advancement of culture...even if that can lead to conflict with those of a more cynical or progressive view.

SWMH: Observe Bema Feast
SED: Observe Bema Feast

EMF: One of the most important religious observances of Manichaeism, the bema feast takes place annually at the vernal equinox. It is meant to celebrate the passion of Mani, and this year you have decided it shall be a feast to remember! Note that, if you enact the decision outside of the yearly timeframe in which the feast occurs, it won't actually begin until the equinox.

SWMH: Found the Army of Light
SED: Found the Army of Light

EMF: Found the Army of Light holy order, in the name of the Manichaean faith.
SWMH: Found the Army of Light holy order, in the name of the Manichaean faith.

SWMH: Found the Army of Lucifer
SED: Found the Army of Lucifer

SWMH: Organize Bogomilist Faith
SED: Organize Bogomil Faith

EMF: As a Bogomilist feudal ruler of great respect and standing, you can lead the faithful to become more organized and respectful of the state's hierarchy.
SWMH: As a Bogomilist feudal ruler of great respect and standing, you can lead the faithful to become more organized and respectful of the state's hierarchy.

EMF: Revive the Knights of Saint Mark
SWMH: Revive the Knights of Saint Mark
SED: Revive the Knights of Saint Mark

EMF: Revive the ancient holy order of the Knights of Saint Mark
SWMH: Revive the ancient holy order of the Knights of Saint Mark
SED: Revive the ancient holy order of the Knights of Saint Mark

SWMH: Raise Zealots
SED: Raise Zealots

EMF: Call on your fellow [Root.Religion.GetName] faithful to rise up and aid your just and holy war!
SWMH: Call on your fellow [Root.Religion.GetName] faithful to rise up and aid your just and holy war!
SED: Call on your fellow [Root.Religion.GetName] faithful to rise up and aid your just and holy war!

SWMH: Restore Order to the Court
SED: Restore Order to the Court

EMF: Perhaps it's not possible to salvage the authority of your throne. It might require a bloody purge of your court, and that will require you to be strong...very strong, indeed.
SWMH: Perhaps it's not possible to salvage the authority of your throne. It might require a bloody purge of your court, and that will require you to be strong...very strong, indeed.
SED: Perhaps its not possible to salvage the authority of your throne. It might require a bloody purge of your court, and that will require you to be strong very strong, indeed.

SWMH: Vassalize Archegos
SED: Vassalize Archegos

EMF: It is only fitting that the Manichaean Archegos be a part of our realm. Perhaps enticing him with the offer of a temple at a holy site would help?
SWMH: It is only fitting that the Manichaean Archegos be a part of our realm. Perhaps enticing him with the offer of a temple at a holy site would help?
SED: It is only fitting that the Manichaean Archegos be a part of our realm. Perhaps enticing him with the offer of a temple at a holy site would help?

SWMH: Vassalize Paulician Patriarch
SED: Vassalize Paulician Patriarch

EMF: As the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], you are perhaps the most prominent Paulician ruler in the world. The Paulician Patriarch would undoubtedly gladly serve under you.
SWMH: As the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], you are perhaps the most prominent Paulician ruler in the world. The Paulician Patriarch would undoubtedly gladly serve under you.
SED: As the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], you are perhaps the most prominent Paulician ruler in the world. The Paulician Patriarch would undoubtedly gladly serve under you.

SWMH: Vassalize Head of Religion
SED: Vassalize Head of Religion

EMF: The leader of the [Root.Religion.GetName] acts as a veritable exile -- without a temple to call their own, a demesne from which to call out to the faithful, and without real legitimacy in the eyes of the world. We could offer that by granting a place within the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], something that would be of benefit to us all.

SWMH: Give to the Poor
SED: Give to the Poor

EMF: Every faithful Waldensian ruler is expected to donate wealth to the poor people of their domain.
SWMH: Every faithful Waldensian ruler is expected to donate wealth to the poor people of their domain.
SED: Every faithful Waldensian ruler is expected to donate wealth to the poor people of their domain.

SWMH: Choose Waldensian Path
SED: Choose Waldensian Path

EMF: The Waldensians offer three different paths for their faithful to follow, each with their individual benefits and drawbacks.
SWMH: The Waldensians offer three different paths for their faithful to follow, each with their individual benefits and drawbacks.
SED: The Waldensians offer three different paths for their faithful to follow, each with their individual benefits and drawbacks.

SWMH: Build Hospital
SED: Build Hospital

EMF: To better care for the poor, your councillors have advised building a hospital in [Root.Capital.GetName] to give proper medical care to the city. While it would be expensive to build and maintain, it would benefit the people enormously.
SWMH: To better care for the poor, your councillors have advised building a hospital in [Root.Capital.GetName] to give proper medical care to the city. While it would be expensive to build and maintain, it would benefit the people enormously.
SED: To better care for the poor, your councillors have advised building a hospital in [Root.Capital.GetName] to give proper medical care to the city. While it would be expensive to build and maintain, it would benefit the people enormously.

SWMH: Celebrate Tawûsgeran
SED: Celebrate Tawûsgeran

EMF: Tawûsgeran, also known as 'Circulation of the Peacock', is an important Yazidi festival where Qewals and other religious dignitaries visit Yazidi villages, bringing the senjaq, sacred images of a peacock made from brass symbolising Tawûsê Melek. These are venerated, taxes are collected from the pious, sermons are preached and holy water distributed.
SWMH: Tawûsgeran, also known as 'Circulation of the Peacock', is an important Yazidi festival where Qewals and other religious dignitaries visit Yazidi villages, bringing the senjaq, sacred images of a peacock made from brass symbolising Tawûsê Melek. These are venerated, taxes are collected from the pious, sermons are preached and holy water distributed.

These are venerated, taxes are collected from the pious, sermons are preached and holy water distributed.

SWMH: Yazidi Pilgrimage
SED: Yazidi Pilgrimage

EMF: Go on a pilgrimage that is of vital importance to the Yazidi faithful: a voyage to visit the Tomb of Sheikh Adi ibn Musafir, and attend the Feast of the Assembly.
SWMH: Go on a pilgrimage that is of vital importance to the Yazidi faithful: a voyage to visit the Tomb of Sheikh Adi ibn Musafir, and attend the Feast of the Assembly.
SED: Go on a pilgrimage that is of vital importance to the Yazidi faithful: a voyage to visit the Tomb of Sheikh Adi ibn Musafir, and attend the Feast of the Assembly.

EMF: Your reputation as a formidable raider has spread even to faraway lands. People everywhere speak the name [Root.GetFirstName] in hushed tones, fearful that in doing so they might invoke you like a vengeful god and bring ruin down upon themselves.
SWMH: Your reputation as a formidable raider has spread even to faraway lands. People everywhere speak the name [Root.GetFirstName] in hushed tones, fearful that in doing so they might invoke you like a vengeful god and bring ruin down upon themselves.

SWMH: Let them fear me!
SED: Let them fear me!

EMF: There is renewed talk in the court of His Holiness, [Root.GetTitledName], of further Christian crusades to retake the Holy Land and fight against the advances of pagans and heathens. Many are expecting His Holiness to issue a call to arms for the faithful any day now.
SWMH: There is renewed talk in the court of His Holiness, [Root.GetTitledName], of further Christian crusades to retake the Holy Land and fight against the advances of pagans and heathens. Many are expecting His Holiness to issue a call to arms for the faithful any day now.

EMF: Rumors abound that there is renewed talk within the court of His Magnificence, [Root.GetTitledName], of issuing a call for another Great Conquest to expand the Dar al-Islam. Righteous Muslims are preparing to join the ranks of the mujahideen should the call to arms be made.

SWMH: Choosing the Shekhinah
SED: Choosing the Shekhinah

EMF: The Manichaeans believed there were five 'Shekhinah', which are the elements where the Divine dwells. Each Manichaean can choose an element upon which to focus, and once chosen that focus cannot be changed.
SWMH: The Manichaeans believed there were five 'Shekhinah', which are the elements where the Divine dwells. Each Manichaean can choose an element upon which to focus, and once chosen that focus cannot be changed.

EMF: I will focus upon Haunâ, or Reason
SWMH: I will focus upon Haunâ, or Reason
SED: I will focus upon Haunâ, or Reason

EMF: I will focus upon Madde'â, or Mind
SWMH: I will focus upon Madde'â, or Mind
SED: I will focus upon Maddeâ, or Mind

EMF: I will focus upon Reyana, or Intelligence
SWMH: I will focus upon Reyana, or Intelligence
SED: I will focus upon Reyana, or Intelligence

EMF: There are other Shekhinah to consider...
SWMH: There are other Shekhinah to consider...

SWMH: I will focus upon Mahíabtâ, or Thought

SWMH: The New Archegos
SED: The New Archegos

EMF: After the Manichean Archegos was murdered by the Caliph in Baghdad, many thought that was the end of the religion as an organized church. But like a phoenix rising from its ashes, [new_manichean_leader.GetTitledName] has been proclaimed the new Archegos by [Root.GetTitledName], with the Manichean faith having enough power now to make him no mere charlatan.

SWMH: A glorious day!
SED: A glorious day!

EMF: And so the heresy grows more powerful...
SWMH: And so the heresy grows more powerful...
SED: And so the heresy grows more powerful

SWMH: The Army of Light
SED: The Army of Light

EMF: The growing power of the Manichaeans can no longer be denied. With the aid of [Root.GetTitledName], a group of fanatics, peasants, and madmen have now banded together to create their own army, to smite heathens and infidels and to protect the righteous. They call themselves the Army of Light, and their holy mission is to fight for the cause of good -- in the eyes of the Manichaeans -- and drive darkness out of the world.

EMF:
My [Root.GetLordLady], this extremely generous donation will not be forgotten. You have my friendship, as well as that of the Manichean Church. Rest assured that you will be rewarded in the afterlife, if not on Earth!
Yours in faith,

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

EMF: Religious leaders from the province of Baghdad are complaining about the prevelance of Manichaean worshippers. 'It is horrible that you can not walk down a street in Baghdad without tripping over half a dozen Manicheans. Why should we let these infidels continue to live while they tempt others away from the true faith?' They are asking that something be done, lest this become an even greater problem in the years to come.

'It is horrible that you can not walk down a street in Baghdad without tripping over half a dozen Manicheans. Why should we let these infidels continue to live while they tempt others away from the true faith?' They are asking that something be done, lest this become an even greater problem in the years to come.
SED: Religious leaders from the province of Baghdad are complaining about the prevelance of Manichaean worshippers. It is horrible that you can not walk down a street in Baghdad without tripping over half a dozen Manicheans. Why should we let these infidels continue to live while they tempt others away from the true faith? They are asking that something be done, lest this become an even greater problem in the years to come.

EMF: We shall crush the Archegos and his followers
SWMH: We shall crush the Archegos and his followers
SED: We shall crush the Archegos and his followers

EMF: No, I will not attack the innocent
SWMH: No, I will not attack the innocent
SED: No, I will not attack the innocent

SWMH: Manichaeans Slaughtered
SED: Manichaeans Slaughtered

EMF: The province of Baghdad was once the center of the Manichaean faith, home to [manichean_leader.GetTitledName] who is their leader. After complaints by [Root.Religion.GetName] worshippers, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has begun a slaughter of all Manichaeans in the region -- beginning with [manichean_leader.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and so ravaging the population that the scholar Ibn al-Nadim reports only finding five remaining in the entire city after the pogrom was finished. The Manicheaean position of Archegos now lies empty, and looks to remain so.

EMF: After the battle is over, your soldiers hail the victory as a great triumph of the Army of Light over your foes, in service to the Army of Darkness.

EMF: You have begun preparations for the Bema Feast, to celebrate the life and death of the Prophet Mani. You send out messengers with invitations to your vassals, expecting all to come and honor [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName].

SWMH: The Singing of Hymns
SED: The Singing of Hymns

EMF: The Bema Feast starts with the singing of various hymns that celebrate the return of spring, the life and death of the Prophet Mani, and the battles the Forces of Light have won over the Armies of Darkness. All those gathered raise their voices to the gods, a chorus of faith and beauty that touches the soul.

SWMH: The Feast of the Elect
SED: The Feast of the Elect

EMF: Only the Elect -- those who are devoted to the Manichaean faith -- are invited to take part in a ritual meal, which both symbolizes the life of Mani and the theology of the Manicheans. To take part is a great honor.
SWMH: Only the Elect -- those who are devoted to the Manichaean faith -- are invited to take part in a ritual meal, which both symbolizes the life of Mani and the theology of the Manicheans. To take part is a great honor.

SWMH: Honor and Glory!
SED: Honor and Glory!

SWMH: The Presentation of the Arzhang
SED: The Presentation of the Arzhang

EMF: The Arzhang, or Picture Book, is a work painted by Mani himself, which depicts the Manichean theology in simple terms, so that even the uneducated can read and understand the faith. The book rests on the bema until the feast is over, after which a priest recites sermons from it and absolves the sins of those attending.
SWMH: The Arzhang, or Picture Book, is a work painted by Mani himself, which depicts the Manichean theology in simple terms, so that even the uneducated can read and understand the faith. The book rests on the bema until the feast is over, after which a priest recites sermons from it and absolves the sins of those attending.

SWMH: Praise be to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
SED: Praise be to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!

SWMH: The Persian Uprising
SED: The Persian Uprising

EMF: It is said that the Abbasids would never have been able to seize the caliphate without the aid of the great Persian general, Abu Muslim, who in the end was rewarded for his service with death -- executed on the order of Caliph Al-Mansur. Resentment for this perceived betrayal has long simmered as resentment among the Persian people, resentment which has now broken out in open rebellion. A peasant leader by the name of Babak, aided by his capable wife Banu, an effective general and archer in her own right, has risen up to free his nation from the unjust rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]...and has already attracted a massive following, enough to present a real threat to the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
SWMH: It is said that the Abbasids would never have been able to seize the caliphate without the aid of the great Persian general, Abu Muslim, who in the end was rewarded for his service with death -- executed on the order of Caliph Al-Mansur. Resentment for this perceived betrayal has long simmered as resentment among the Persian people, resentment which has now broken out in open rebellion. A peasant leader by the name of Babak, aided by his capable wife Banu, an effective general and archer in her own right, has risen up to free his nation from the unjust rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]...and has already attracted a massive following, enough to present a real threat to the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].

A peasant leader by the name of Babak, aided by his capable wife Banu, an effective general and archer in her own right, has risen up to free his nation from the unjust rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and has already attracted a massive following, enough to present a real threat to the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].

SED: This is an outrage!

SWMH: It's about time!
SED: Its about time!

SWMH: The Mazdaki Priesthood
SED: The Mazdakite Priesthood

EMF: Although the Prophet Mazdak always railed against the corruption of the Zoroastrian Priesthood, and his followers have never had an official structure to speak of, now that the faith has risen to such prominence under [Root.GetTitledName] it seems the time has come to give it to them. With [new_mazdaki_leader.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] chosen as the new [new_mazdaki_leader.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of the [new_mazdaki_leader.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], the Mazdaki faith has entered a new era, with a priesthood rivalling that of the Zoroastrians from which they once stemmed...and have, perhaps, now exceeded.
SWMH: Although the Prophet Mazdak always railed against the corruption of the Zoroastrian Priesthood, and his followers have never had an official structure to speak of, now that the faith has risen to such prominence under [Root.GetTitledName] it seems the time has come to give it to them. With [new_mazdaki_leader.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] chosen as the new [new_mazdaki_leader.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of the [new_mazdaki_leader.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], the Mazdakite faith has entered a new era, with a priesthood rivalling that of the Zoroastrians from which they once stemmed and have, perhaps, now exceeded.

SWMH: A glorious day!
SED: A glorious day!

EMF: The Mazdaki teach there are four Powers that bring Light into the World: Discernment, Understanding, Preservation, and Joy. Any adult member of the faith may embrace one of these Powers. in an attempt to achieve eventual perfection.

EMF: I choose the Power of Joy

EMF: You have begun preparations for the Tawûsgeran festival, also known as the 'Circulation of the Peacock'. You send out messengers with invitations to your Yazidi vassals, expecting all to come and honor Melek Taus, greatest among the seven angels.

EMF: I've been looking forward to this
SWMH: I've been looking forward to this
SED: Ive been looking forward to this

EMF:
[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],

The time has come once again for us all to celebrate the Tawûsgeran, a time to honor Melek Taus - He who is most holy amongst the seven angels. The festival will take place in [From.Capital.GetName], and you are hereby formally invited to attend.
Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],

EMF: The Tawûsgeran festival is well under way when you finally arrive in [FromFrom.Capital.GetName]. Priests walk throughout the crowds, giving out vials of holy water to the faithful. You can hear the holy rites to the Seven being chanted at shrines everywhere you walk, though the name of Melek Taus is most prominent amongst them.

SWMH: An excellent time, to be sure

EMF: Peasants are streaming into [Root.Capital.GetName] from all over [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] for the beginning of the Tawûsgeran festival, and already your vassals are arriving. The chanting of rites to Melek Taus can be heard from the many shrines at your window, and soon the true celebrations will begin.

The chanting of rites to Melek Taus can be heard from the many shrines at your window, and soon the true celebrations will begin.

SWMH: The Circulation of the Peacock
SED: The Circulation of the Peacock

EMF: The Circulation of the Peacock is about to start! In accordance with tradition, priests and pious men carry the senjaq, statues of the Seven Archangels, in circles around the city as they distribute blessings. To carry one of the statues is an honor reserved for only those of great wisdom and piety, as well as an event requiring considerable strength and willpower.
SWMH: The Circulation of the Peacock is about to start! In accordance with tradition, priests and pious men carry the senjaq, statues of the Seven Archangels, in circles around the city as they distribute blessings. To carry one of the statues is an honor reserved for only those of great wisdom and piety, as well as an event requiring considerable strength and willpower.
SED: The Circulation of the Peacock is about to start! In accordance with tradition, priests and pious men carry the senjaq, statues of the Seven Archangels, in circles around the city as they distribute blessings. To carry one of the statues is an honor reserved for only those of great wisdom and piety, as well as an event requiring considerable strength and willpower.

EMF: I wish to carry one of the statues!
SWMH: I wish to carry one of the statues!
SED: I wish to carry one of the statues!

EMF: I am content to watch the proceedings
SWMH: I am content to watch the proceedings
SED: I am content to watch the proceedings

EMF: As you carry the senjaq around, you discover that it is rather heavier than you expected. The unaccustomed weight causes you to stumble, and the idol slips out of your hands and crashes down to the ground and is damaged. Everyone stares in horror as you quickly pick it back up.
SWMH: As you carry the senjaq around, you discover that it is rather heavier than you expected. The unaccustomed weight causes you to stumble, and the idol slips out of your hands and crashes down to the ground and is damaged. Everyone stares in horror as you quickly pick it back up.

EMF: Only a few people saw that...right?
SWMH: Only a few people saw that...right?
SED: Only a few people saw that right?

EMF: As you carry the heavy senjaq around, the weight and the heat begin to take their toll upon you. As if in a dream, you begin to hear the voices of the Seven Archangels talking, telling you secrets and mysteries...
SWMH: As you carry the heavy senjaq around, the weight and the heat begin to take their toll upon you. As if in a dream, you begin to hear the voices of the Seven Archangels talking, telling you secrets and mysteries...
SED: As you carry the heavy senjaq around, the weight and the heat begin to take their toll upon you. As if in a dream, you begin to hear the voices of the Seven Archangels talking, telling you secrets and mysteries

EMF: They have visited me! I am blessed!
SWMH: They have visited me! I am blessed!
SED: They have visited me! I am blessed!

EMF: With each step of the Circulation, more and more of the truth of your faith is reveled to you. Of course this is the proper path. How could any man doubt such a truth?
SWMH: With each step of the Circulation, more and more of the truth of your faith is reveled to you. Of course this is the proper path. How could any man doubt such a truth?
SED: With each step of the Circulation, more and more of the truth of your faith is reveled to you. Of course this is the proper path. How could any man doubt such a truth?

EMF: For the glory of Menek Taus!
SWMH: For the glory of Menek Taus!
SED: For the glory of Menek Taus!

EMF: Perhaps it is the power of faith that fills you, but what once seemed so heavy at the beginning now feels as light as feather. Why, you could carry this senjaq around all day if the priests would let you!
SWMH: Perhaps it is the power of faith that fills you, but what once seemed so heavy at the beginning now feels as light as feather. Why, you could carry this senjaq around all day if the priests would let you!
SED: Perhaps it is the power of faith that fills you, but what once seemed so heavy at the beginning now feels as light as feather. Why, you could carry this senjaq around all day if the priests would let you!

SWMH: Strength comes from faith
SED: Strength comes from faith

SWMH: Veneration of the Senjaq
SED: Veneration of the Senjaq

EMF: After the senjaq have been paraded around the city, the populace of the city comes forward to present their sacrifices and tributes. You visit each senjaq in turn, praying for the wisdom of the Seven Archangels, venerating them with holy incense.
SWMH: After the senjaq have been paraded around the city, the populace of the city comes forward to present their sacrifices and tributes. You visit each senjaq in turn, praying for the wisdom of the Seven Archangels, venerating them with holy incense.

SWMH: For Wisdom and Honor
SED: For Wisdom and Honor

SWMH: Gifts From the Pious
SED: Gifts From the Pious

EMF: The final stage of the Tawûsgeran festival is the collection of alms from the pious. Every man and woman is expected to give, a contribution to the greater faith and in support of those in need. While most give only a few coins, those who are able are expected to give much more.
SWMH: The final stage of the Tawûsgeran festival is the collection of alms from the pious. Every man and woman is expected to give, a contribution to the greater faith and in support of those in need. While most give only a few coins, those who are able are expected to give much more.

SWMH: I am a pious [Root.GetManWoman]
SED: I am a pious [Root.GetManWoman]

EMF: I will give what I must, no more
SWMH: I will give what I must, no more
SED: I will give what I must, no more

SWMH: Ignore this nonsense
SED: Ignore this nonsense

EMF: The final ceremony is a grand sermon of thanksgiving to God and his servants. It was a rousing sermon as always, and the crowd begins the feast with great abandon. Another glorious celebration of the Seven Archangels has been completed!
SWMH: The final ceremony is a grand sermon of thanksgiving to God and his servants. It was a rousing sermon as always, and the crowd begins the feast with great abandon. Another glorious celebration of the Seven Archangels has been completed!
SED: The final ceremony is a grand sermon of thanksgiving to God and his servants. It was a rousing sermon as always, and the crowd begins the feast with great abandon. Another glorious celebration of the Seven Archangels has been completed!

SWMH: Praise the Seven!
SED: Praise the Seven!

EMF: The Tawûsgeran is over for now, and already the many decorations are being taken down. Melek Taus has been properly honored, and the realm is looking forward to a bright future under His wisdom.
SWMH: The Tawûsgeran is over for now, and already the many decorations are being taken down. Melek Taus has been properly honored, and the realm is looking forward to a bright future under His wisdom.
SED: The Tawûsgeran is over for now, and already the many decorations are being taken down. Melek Taus has been properly honored, and the realm is looking forward to a bright future under His wisdom.

SWMH: Until next time!
SED: Until next time!

EMF: Sadly, the death of [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] means the Circulation of the Peacock must be canceled.
SWMH: Sadly, the death of [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] means the Circulation of the Peacock must be canceled.
SED: Sadly, the death of [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] means the Circulation of the Peacock must be canceled.

SWMH: Such is how it is
SED: Such is how it is

SWMH: A Koasasa is Discovered
SED: A Koasasa is Discovered

EMF: The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the Yazidi faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Peacock Angel himself, Melek Taus. Yazidi throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.
SWMH: The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the Yazidi faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Peacock Angel himself, Melek Taus. Yazidi throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

EMF: I will do my best to live up to this honor

EMF: A glorious day for us all
SWMH: A glorious day for us all
SED: A glorious day for us all

EMF: The pilgrimage to Lalish, a site just outside of the bustling city of Mosul, is one of the most important journeys a Yazidi can undertake. There one attends the Feast of the Assembly, and returns filled with the spirit and strength of the Seven Archangels...or so the story goes.
SWMH: The pilgrimage to Lalish, a site just outside of the bustling city of Mosul, is one of the most important journeys a Yazidi can undertake. There one attends the Feast of the Assembly, and returns filled with the spirit and strength of the Seven Archangels...or so the story goes.

EMF: The day has come. Your belongings are packed, arrangements have been made for matters in [Root.Capital.GetName] to be attended to while you are away, and your departure has been kept quiet to prevent the unsavory from taking advantage of your solitary journey. Now you must begin your journey to Lalish.
SWMH: The day has come. Your belongings are packed, arrangements have been made for matters in [Root.Capital.GetName] to be attended to while you are away, and your departure has been kept quiet to prevent the unsavory from taking advantage of your solitary journey. Now you must begin your journey to Lalish.

Your belongings are packed, arrangements have been made for matters in [Root.Capital.GetName] to be attended to while you are away, and your departure has been kept quiet to prevent the unsavory from taking advantage of your solitary journey. Now you must begin your journey to Lalish.

SWMH: Arrival at Lalish
SED: Arrival at Lalish

EMF: You arrive in the bustling city of holy Mosul, and it is not long before you make your way to Lalish, a mountain valley village not far to the north. This sleepy place is where the Yazidi faith truly began, and as the Feast of the Assembly unfolds, prayers offered to the Seven Archangels up in the heavens, you marvel at the conical roofs of Sheikh Adi ibn Musafir's tomb. The rest of your stay will be spent in Mosul, but you cannot help but feel overcome at having taken a path so many have walked before you.

The rest of your stay will be spent in Mosul, but you cannot help but feel overcome at having taken a path so many have walked before you.

SWMH: Now, what to do next?
SED: Now, what to do next?

SWMH: The Yazidi Faith
SED: The Yazidi Faith

EMF: There are many who claim the Yazidi to be devil-worshippers, due to their veneration of the Peacock Angel they call Melek Taus or Shaytan. This has led the Yazidi to be considered Muslim heretics for countless generations, even though their religion incorporates syncretic elements of not only the Muslim faith but also Gnosticism and Zoroastrianism. Now, with [Root.GetTitledName] having risen to such power, [Root.GetSheHe] has declared the Yazidi to be their own faith and no heresy -- and [Root.GetSheHe] has the prestige to be listened to. In the end, it may change nothing save to the Yazidi themselves, but even so it is a sign as to just how far they have come since the ancient days of worshipping at hidden temples in the Kurdish foothills.

In the end, it may change nothing save to the Yazidi themselves, but even so it is a sign as to just how far they have come since the ancient days of worshipping at hidden temples in the Kurdish foothills.

SED: A New Reign

EMF: You are now the Caliph and, according to the tradition set by the 'Abbasids, may take a regnal name by which you shall henceforth be known, a name representing the virtues you seek to engender during your rule. Alternatively, you may break with tradition and keep your own name.
SWMH: You are now the Caliph and, according to the tradition set by the 'Abbasids, may take a regnal name by which you shall henceforth be known, a name representing the virtues you seek to engender during your rule. Alternatively, you may break with tradition and keep your own name.

SWMH: Anarchy at [Root.Capital.GetName]
SED: Anarchy at [Root.Capital.GetName]

EMF: Dire events are underway in [Root.Capital.GetName], capital to the mighty [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]: [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], considered by many to be a weak caliph, has been turned into a veritable prisoner within his own palace. His advisors have taken control of the court, and already cracks have begun to appear in its authority over the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]'s vassals. Whether [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will be able to regain control or whether the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] will crumble into anarchy is currently unknown.

EMF: While [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has taken command of the Sunni caliphate, the court remains firmly in control. You will have to be strong if you are to overcome their rule and restore order.

SED: They will not get away with this

SWMH: Order Restored in [Root.Capital.GetName]
SED: Order Restored in [Root.Capital.GetName]

EMF: It has taken a bloody coup, with [imprisoned_regent.GetTitledName] being overthrown and imprisoned, but [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has restored order in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. The Sunni caliphate once again has authority respected by its vassals. It remains to be seen whether [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will exact more vengeance upon those of his court who kept him hostage, and whether he will be able to bring the lands he lost back under his fold.

EMF: This is a good thing, I think

EMF: The court of [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] runs rampant with anarchy and corruption. Perhaps it is time for the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] to declare its independence before the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] crumbles completely and takes you with it?

EMF: Yes, let us make our own way
SWMH: Yes, let us make our own way
SED: Yes, let us make our own way

EMF: No, I am loyal to the caliph!
SWMH: No, I am loyal to the caliph!
SED: No, I am loyal to the caliph!

EMF: Alas, the anarchy rampant within the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has claimed another victim: from your quarters in the palace, you hear that [From.GetTitledName] has declared [From.GetHerHis] independence from the caliphate in pure disgust. Naturally your court is at odds regarding what to do about it.
SWMH: Alas, the anarchy rampant within the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has claimed another victim: from your quarters in the palace, you hear that [From.GetTitledName] has declared [From.GetHerHis] independence from the caliphate in pure disgust. Naturally your court is at odds regarding what to do about it.

Naturally your court is at odds regarding what to do about it.

EMF: After the unjust murder of his son by local authorities, a follower of the Kharijite sect of Islam by the name of Musawir ibn 'Abd al-Hamid al-Shari has launched an insurrection in the province of Mosul, aiming to toppling the rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. This presents a serious threat to the caliph, and further evidence of the reign of anarchy in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].

EMF: 'I, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], being sane of spirit and body and duly qualified, attest on my soul, without compulsion or constraint, that I renounce all the different cults, religions, and creeds and acknowledge nothing other than obedience to our Lord al-Hakim, revered be his name, and obedience is worship, that in his worship I associate no past, present, or future being, that I commit my soul, my body, my property, and my offspring to our Lord al-Hakim the guide of those who respond to the divine call and the avenger on the polytheists with the sword of our Lord.'\n\nWith those words, you have ascended to the rank of Initiate, and have now been given leave to study the Druze manuscripts and attend the meetings of other Initiates, the true leaders of your faith.

EMF: The schism at the heart of Islam dates back to its earliest days. The majority Sunnis have long persecuted the followers of Isma'il, forcing them into hiding. The partisans of Ali look to his descendants for leadership, but they are forced to keep their ancestry secret. Now though, they are mobilizing their strength behind a young man by the name of [ismaili_revolter.GetFirstName] whom they claim to be Isma'il's rightful heir and Imam. Other Islamic jurists claim the boy is clearly a fraud, but to his followers he is the one they have been waiting for and now they flock to his banner as he begins his crusade to wrest the [ismaili_revolt_target_title.GetFullName] from the hands of [ismaili_revolt_target.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal].
