EMF: [Root.Educator.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has spoken to you a great deal about the ideals behind the Cathar faith, and how one who aspires to be closer to God must conduct themselves. [Root.Educator.GetHerHisCap] words have made a great impact upon you.
SWMH: [Root.Educator.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has spoken to you a great deal about the ideals behind the Cathar faith, and how one who aspires to be closer to God must conduct themselves. [Root.Educator.GetHerHisCap] words have made a great impact upon you.

EMF: I will be a good Cathar, I think
SWMH: I will be a good Cathar, I think
SED: I will be a good Cathar, I think

EMF: The Cathar Church frowns upon contact with members of the opposite sex. Thus you are raised mostly among other Cathar men, and rarely see girls your age at all. You start to feel strange urges, and it occurs to you that the church really only frowns upon reproduction...
SWMH: The Cathar Church frowns upon contact with members of the opposite sex. Thus you are raised mostly among other Cathar men, and rarely see girls your age at all. You start to feel strange urges, and it occurs to you that the church really only frowns upon reproduction...

SWMH: It's technically not banned...
SED: Its technically not banned

EMF: The Cathar Church frowns upon contact with members of the opposite sex. Thus you are raised mostly among other Cathar women, and rarely see boys your age at all. You start to feel strange urges, and it occurs to you that the church really only frowns upon reproduction...

EMF: A life of sinful urges is not something you can relegate yourself to. You are a devout Cathar, and that means that such sins are best put behind you.
SWMH: A life of sinful urges is not something you can relegate yourself to. You are a devout Cathar, and that means that such sins are best put behind you.
SED: A life of sinful urges is not something you can relegate yourself to. You are a devout Cathar, and that means that such sins are best put behind you.

SWMH: For the glory of God!
SED: For the glory of God!

EMF: After a long search, a young boy has been found who might make for an ideal candidate. Your councillors tell you he comes from an orphanage in [adopted_province.GetName], his parents both killed by a recent plague. Although a bit grimy and shy, you feel the child might make a good ruler one day, provided he is cleaned up and raised properly.
SWMH: After a long search, a young boy has been found who might make for an ideal candidate. Your councillors tell you he comes from an orphanage in [adopted_province.GetName], his parents both killed by a recent plague. Although a bit grimy and shy, you feel the child might make a good ruler one day, provided he is cleaned up and raised properly.
SED: After a long search, a young boy has been found who might make for an ideal candidate. Your councillors tell you he comes from an orphanage in [adopted_province.GetName], his parents both killed by a recent plague. Although a bit grimy and shy, you feel the child might make a good ruler one day, provided he is cleaned up and raised properly.

SWMH: I suppose he will do
SED: I suppose he will do

SWMH: The Council of [council_location.GetName]
SED: The Council of [council_location.GetName]

EMF: A Cathar heresy has been brewing for some time, begun by numerous ascetic priests who espouse strange beliefs regarding there being two Gods--a 'Good God' who created the spiritual realm, and an 'Evil God' who created the material realm and all of humanity, and the reason why all humans are filled with sin--but with the gathering of these priests at a council in the province of [From.GetName], the heresy has begun to spread like wildfire. At this council, the priests codified many of their laws and spread territories into 'bishoprics', and they have since gained many followers.
SWMH: A Cathar heresy has been brewing for some time, begun by numerous ascetic priests who espouse strange beliefs regarding there being two Gods--a 'Good God' who created the spiritual realm, and an 'Evil God' who created the material realm and all of humanity, and the reason why all humans are filled with sin--but with the gathering of these priests at a council in the province of [From.GetName], the heresy has begun to spread like wildfire. At this council, the priests codified many of their laws and spread territories into 'bishoprics', and they have since gained many followers.
SED: A Cathar heresy has been brewing for some time, begun by numerous ascetic priests who espouse strange beliefs regarding there being two Godsa Good God who created the spiritual realm, and an Evil God who created the material realm and all of humanity, and the reason why all humans are filled with sinbut with the gathering of these priests at a council in the province of [From.GetName], the heresy has begun to spread like wildfire. At this council, the priests codified many of their laws and spread territories into bishoprics, and they have since gained many followers.

SWMH: Another heresy? In MY lands?!
SED: Another heresy? In MY lands?!

SWMH: This heresy must be stopped!
SED: This heresy must be stopped!

EMF: They are led by a Bogomilist, I hear
SWMH: They are led by a Bogomilist, I hear
SED: They are led by a Bogomil, I hear

SWMH: The Albigensian Crusade
SED: The Albigensian Crusade

EMF: The Cathar faithful desire nothing more than peace, but the men of this evil world will not let that be. And so, a change in philosophy is in order. The Cathar are now permitted, no required, to make holy war upon the unbelievers in order to drive them off and bring about the salvation of mankind.
SWMH: The Cathar faithful desire nothing more than peace, but the men of this evil world will not let that be. And so, a change in philosophy is in order. The Cathar are now permitted, no required, to make holy war upon the unbelievers in order to drive them off and bring about the salvation of mankind.
SED: The Cathar faithful desire nothing more than peace, but the men of this evil world will not let that be. And so, a change in philosophy is in order. The Cathar are now permitted, no required, to make holy war upon the unbelievers in order to drive them off and bring about the salvation of mankind.

SWMH: So must it be
SED: So must it be

SWMH: The Cathar Patriarchy
SED: The Cathar Patriarchy

EMF: The growing power of the Cathar Church has led it to organize itself as a reflection of the Catholic Church. Created through the political will of [From.GetBestName], this new Church has a leader: [new_cathar_pope.GetTitledName], elected at a special gathering of bishops in [From.Capital.GetName]. The Cathar world rejoices at the news!

EMF: Is this their idea of a Pope?
SWMH: Is this their idea of a Pope?

EMF: And so the Christian world devours itself
SWMH: And so the Christian world devours itself
SED: And so the Christian world devours itself

SWMH: Glory to Jesus!
SED: Glory to Jesus!

SWMH: [lollard_founder.GetFullName]
SED: [lollard_founder.GetFullName]

EMF: A discredited seminary student by the name of John Wycliff has been spending his time in [new_lollard_stronghold.GetName], preaching his heretical thoughts on the Bible to the peasants--specifically that the Catholic Church must be reformed. He speaks out against the greed and excess of Catholic priests, the Sacrament of the Eucharist, and the over-emphasis of reverence paid to Christian idols. Many peasants, having no love for the corrupt priests of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], have embraced his teachings and the Lollard heresy is spreading like wildfire throughout the countryside.
SWMH: A discredited seminary student by the name of John Wycliff has been spending his time in [new_lollard_stronghold.GetName], preaching his heretical thoughts on the Bible to the peasants--specifically that the Catholic Church must be reformed. He speaks out against the greed and excess of Catholic priests, the Sacrament of the Eucharist, and the over-emphasis of reverence paid to Christian idols. Many peasants, having no love for the corrupt priests of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], have embraced his teachings and the Lollard heresy is spreading like wildfire throughout the countryside.

SWMH: Where is my Archbishop?
SED: Where is my Archbishop?

SWMH: Terrible!
SED: Terrible!

SWMH: A wise man indeed
SED: A wise man indeed

EMF: Let the heathens fight each other
SWMH: Let the heathens fight each other
SED: Let the heathens fight each other

EMF: As you men storm the church, they discover a rich cache of icons and relics, all of it gilded in gold and surely belonging to [From.Owner.GetTitledName]. Such greed and devotion to icons goes against everything the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith stands for...but this is still a holy place, is it not?
SWMH: As you men storm the church, they discover a rich cache of icons and relics, all of it gilded in gold and surely belonging to [From.Owner.GetTitledName]. EMF: Destroy them, and take the gold
SWMH: Destroy them, and take the gold

EMF: I will not desecrate such beauty
SWMH: I will not desecrate such beauty
SED: I will not desecrate such beauty

SWMH: Translation of the Bible
SED: Translation of the Bible

EMF: Several years ago, [Root.GetTitledName] ordered a translation of the Bible into the vernacular. The [Root.Religion.GetName]s believe, after all, that one of the way the Catholic Church maintains control over the masses is by restricting those who can read it to those educated few versed in the ancient tongue of Latin. A non-Latin Bible is, then, something of a revelation. Fortunately, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s Bible is considered to be a fine translation: clear, easy to read, and already quite popular with the common man.

A non-Latin Bible is, then, something of a revelation. Fortunately, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s Bible is considered to be a fine translation: clear, easy to read, and already quite popular with the common man.

EMF: This is an affront to God!

EMF: Several years ago, [Root.GetTitledName] ordered a translation of the Bible into the vernacular. The [Root.Religion.GetName]s believe, after all, that one of the way the Catholic Church maintains control over the masses is by restricting those who can read it to those educated few versed in the ancient tongue of Latin. A non-Latin Bible is, then, something of a revelation. Unfortunately for [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], [Root.GetHerHis] new Bible is not only considered something of a poor translation -- with far too many parts obviously swayed by the politics of the day -- it is mostly mocked outside of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and mostly disregarded. Even so, it is of great interest to many, and has aided the spread of the [Root.Religion.GetName]s faith.

EMF:
[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],
You are a holy [Root.GetManWoman], it is true...but you are also not a believer in the ideals we Lollards uphold. You revel in excess and greed, and thus I cannot allow you to retain your titles in [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. They are to be revoked at once, and given to a more worthy member of the clergy.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

EMF:
[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],

A good [Root.GetManWoman] of the Lord should attend to more simple matters. Thus I hereby declare that your greater titles be claimed by the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].

Signed,
[From.GetTitledFirstName]

SWMH: Brother Angelo
SED: Brother Angelo

EMF: A disgruntled Catholic monk by the name of Brother Angelo has heavily criticized [Root.GetTitledName], and in so doing has rocked the authority of the Roman Catholic Church. Brother Angelo denies that [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is legally the pope, as [Root.GetSheHe] has abrogated the Rule of St. Francis -- which, according to his doctrine, represented the pure and simple Gospel. He has asserted that all of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s decrees are thus invalid, and that all Catholics who follow the Pope's will have lost the grace of God.
SWMH: A disgruntled Catholic monk by the name of Brother Angelo has heavily criticized [Root.GetTitledName], and in so doing has rocked the authority of the Roman Catholic Church. Brother Angelo denies that [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is legally the pope, as [Root.GetSheHe] has abrogated the Rule of St. Francis -- which, according to his doctrine, represented the pure and simple Gospel. He has asserted that all of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s decrees are thus invalid, and that all Catholics who follow the Pope's will have lost the grace of God.

He has asserted that all of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]s decrees are thus invalid, and that all Catholics who follow the Popes will have lost the grace of God.

EMF: The man is clearly a heretic

EMF: He sounds like a man with the right ideas

EMF: The words of Brother Angelo have been weighing on your soul. Too many churchmen are more concerned more with power and money than with their holy calling, and the result is a Catholic Church that is rife with corruption. Perhaps the Fraticelli are right?

SWMH: The Poor of [poor_of_lyons.GetName]
SED: The Poor of [poor_of_lyons.GetName]

EMF: A wealthy merchant of [poor_of_lyons.GetName] by the name of Pierre Valdes gave up all his earthly possessions and began wandering the countryside as a preacher after a brush with death. He has been condemning the Catholic Church for its corruption, as well as calling for a return to a more Biblical lifestyle. The man has rapidly gained followers amongst the poor of [poor_of_lyons.GetName], and his disciples have ranged even further and begun seeking converts elsewhere -- enough to cause considerable concern within the Catholic hierarchy.

EMF: The founding of the Waldensian Church was mostly underground, and the so the early initiates organized themselves into cells. The Doctores would lead the cells and train Novellani, who would go and preach to the masses, while the Sandaliati would travel to keep the cells in touch. It is a tradition that has continued to this day.

It is a tradition that has continued to this day.

SWMH: I am Doctores

SWMH: I am Novellani
SED: I am Novellani

EMF: As a Waldensian [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], you are considered to have brought considerable renown to the cause. What some might have disregarded as a passing thing is now given far more serious weight in the world, perhaps even enough to one day challenge the gravitas of the Pope himself.
SWMH: As a Waldensian [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], you are considered to have brought considerable renown to the cause. What some might have disregarded as a passing thing is now given far more serious weight in the world, perhaps even enough to one day challenge the gravitas of the Pope himself.
SED: As a Waldensian [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], you are considered to have brought considerable renown to the cause. What some might have disregarded as a passing thing is now given far more serious weight in the world, perhaps even enough to one day challenge the gravitas of the Pope himself.

SWMH: Lux Lucit in Tenebris!
SED: Lux Lucit in Tenebris!

EMF: As your men storm the church, you cut down a [From.Owner.Religion.GetName] priest trying to protect a relic, gilded in gold. These false idols are a means to deceive the peasants and confuse ignorant fools. You are of half a mind to destroy them and return the wealth to the people.
SWMH: As your men storm the church, you cut down a [From.Owner.Religion.GetName] priest trying to protect a relic, gilded in gold. These false idols are a means to deceive the peasants and confuse ignorant fools. You are of half a mind to destroy them and return the wealth to the people.
SED: As your men storm the church, you cut down a [From.Owner.Religion.GetName] priest trying to protect a relic, gilded in gold. These false idols are a means to deceive the peasants and confuse ignorant fools. You are of half a mind to destroy them and return the wealth to the people.

SWMH: Do it
SED: Do it

EMF: I would rather keep it for myself
SWMH: I would rather keep it for myself
SED: I would rather keep it for myself

EMF: Rome, the Eternal City, and the source of all the corruption of the Church. It is full of treasures stolen from the people, false relics to deceive the gullible. Your men have their orders: destroy them all, and return the wealth to the people.
SWMH: Rome, the Eternal City, and the source of all the corruption of the Church. It is full of treasures stolen from the people, false relics to deceive the gullible. Your men have their orders: destroy them all, and return the wealth to the people.
SED: Rome, the Eternal City, and the source of all the corruption of the Church. It is full of treasures stolen from the people, false relics to deceive the gullible. Your men have their orders: destroy them all, and return the wealth to the people.

EMF: Canterbury, where the tomb Thomas Beckett lies...or lied, since it is there no longer. The tomb has been destroyed by your holy wrath, no longer able to tempt poor Christian fools away from devoting their faith to false relics, and the wealth of its riches returned to the people.
SWMH: Canterbury, where the tomb Thomas Beckett lies...or lied, since it is there no longer. The tomb has been destroyed by your holy wrath, no longer able to tempt poor Christian fools away from devoting their faith to false relics, and the wealth of its riches returned to the people.
SED: Canterbury, where the tomb of Thomas Becket lies or lay, since it is there no longer. The tomb has been destroyed by your holy wrath, no longer able to tempt poor Christian fools away from devoting their faith to false relics, and the wealth of its riches returned to the people.

EMF: You don't know who is buried in this shrine, but you know it is not St. James. That is just a false legend made to trick pilgrims and take their money. Well, no longer. You give the bones a proper burial, and then burn the shrine down around you. The wealth of its relics have been returned to the people.
SWMH: You don't know who is buried in this shrine, but you know it is not St. James. That is just a false legend made to trick pilgrims and take their money. Well, no longer. You give the bones a proper burial, and then burn the shrine down around you. The wealth of its relics have been returned to the people.
SED: You dont know who is buried in this shrine, but you know it is not St. James. That is just a false legend made to trick pilgrims and take their money. Well, no longer. You give the bones a proper burial, and then burn the shrine down around you. The wealth of its relics have been returned to the people.

EMF: In the Cathedral of Köln, there lies the Sarcophagus of the Magi: over two meters of gilded silver and jewels. Why waste such wealth on falsehoods, idols that lure the foolish away from their true faith in God, when it could be given to the poor?
SWMH: In the Cathedral of Köln, there lies the Sarcophagus of the Magi: over two meters of gilded silver and jewels. Why waste such wealth on falsehoods, idols that lure the foolish away from their true faith in God, when it could be given to the poor?
SED: In the Cathedral of Cologne, there lies the Sarcophagus of the Magi: over two meters of gilded silver and jewels. Why waste such wealth on falsehoods, idols that lure the foolish away from their true faith in God, when it could be given to the poor?

SWMH: So must it be
SED: So must it be

SWMH: The Sacking of [FromFrom.GetName]
SED: The Sacking of [FromFrom.GetName]

EMF: After the Waldensians seized Rome, they proceeded to destroy any and all holy relics they could reach, stripping all the wealth from the Roman churches. The bones of St. Peter have been thrown out and cast into the street, the Chains of St. Paul melted down, and the Scala Santa smashed and destroyed. Catholics everywhere are distraught.
SWMH: After the Waldensians seized Rome, they proceeded to destroy any and all holy relics they could reach, stripping all the wealth from the Roman churches. The bones of St. Peter have been thrown out and cast into the street, the Chains of St. Paul melted down, and the Scala Santa smashed and destroyed. Catholics everywhere are distraught.
SED: After the Waldensians seized Rome, they proceeded to destroy any and all holy relics they could reach, stripping all the wealth from the Roman churches. The bones of St. Peter have been thrown out and cast into the street, the Chains of St. Paul melted down, and the Scala Santa smashed and destroyed. Catholics everywhere are distraught.

EMF: Canterbury, the great pilgrimage site for all of the British Isles has been destroyed, the tomb of St. Thomas Beckett desecrated by the Waldensians. Even as the heretics rejoice at their victory, so are Catholics elsewhere distraught at the loss of the holy relics now cast aside as worthless.
SWMH: Canterbury, the great pilgrimage site for all of the British Isles has been destroyed, the tomb of St. Thomas Beckett desecrated by the Waldensians. Even as the heretics rejoice at their victory, so are Catholics elsewhere distraught at the loss of the holy relics now cast aside as worthless.
SED: Canterbury, the great pilgrimage site for all of the British Isles has been destroyed, the tomb of St. Thomas Becket desecrated by the Waldensians. Even as the heretics rejoice at their victory, so are Catholics elsewhere distraught at the loss of the holy relics now cast aside as worthless.

EMF: The Way of St. James has no endpoint now, as Santiago de Compostela has fallen to the Waldensians. The shrine of St. James has been destroyed, the bones once therein now missing, and the many holy relics which belonged to the shrine have either been destroyed or cast to the people as trinkets.
SWMH: The Way of St. James has no endpoint now, as Santiago de Compostela has fallen to the Waldensians. The shrine of St. James has been destroyed, the bones once therein now missing, and the many holy relics which belonged to the shrine have either been destroyed or cast to the people as trinkets.
SED: The Way of St. James has no endpoint now, as Santiago de Compostela has fallen to the Waldensians. The shrine of St. James has been destroyed, the bones once therein now missing, and the many holy relics which belonged to the shrine have either been destroyed or cast to the people as trinkets.

EMF: The Grand Cathedral of Köln now smoulders as the Waldensians strip it of everything of value. Countless relics have been destroyed, including the Sarcophagus of the Magi: over two meters of gilded silver and jewels, all melted down. The Waldensians say that the poor shall be able to eat for a year on what was stored there.
SWMH: The Grand Cathedral of Köln now smoulders as the Waldensians strip it of everything of value. Countless relics have been destroyed, including the Sarcophagus of the Magi: over two meters of gilded silver and jewels, all melted down. The Waldensians say that the poor shall be able to eat for a year on what was stored there.
SED: The Grand Cathedral of Cologne now smoulders as the Waldensians strip it of everything of value. Countless relics have been destroyed, including the Sarcophagus of the Magi: over two meters of gilded silver and jewels, all melted down. The Waldensians say that the poor shall be able to eat for a year on what was stored there.

SWMH: Sacrilege!
SED: Sacrilege!

EMF: A victory for sense and righteousness!
SWMH: A victory for sense and righteousness!
SED: A victory for sense and righteousness!

EMF: All Waldensian lords are expect to give charity to the poor and disenfranchised in their realm. Now, that tenet is tested as a large number of refugees have arrived into [Root.Capital.GetName] from the provinces of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. The war has left them destitute, and their numbers have overwhelmed the ability of the city to support them.
SWMH: All Waldensian lords are expect to give charity to the poor and disenfranchised in their realm. Now, that tenet is tested as a large number of refugees have arrived into [Root.Capital.GetName] from the provinces of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. The war has left them destitute, and their numbers have overwhelmed the ability of the city to support them.
SED: All Waldensian lords are expect to give charity to the poor and disenfranchised in their realm. Now, that tenet is tested as a large number of refugees have arrived into [Root.Capital.GetName] from the provinces of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. The war has left them destitute, and their numbers have overwhelmed the ability of the city to support them.

SWMH: They must be helped
SED: They must be helped

EMF: There is nothing to be done
SWMH: There is nothing to be done
SED: There is nothing to be done

EMF: In the sermon today, your priest expounded on the sin of greed, and how no greedy [Root.GetManWoman] can enter heaven. You just wish he didn't use yourself as an example.
SWMH: In the sermon today, your priest expounded on the sin of greed, and how no greedy [Root.GetManWoman] can enter heaven. You just wish he didn't use yourself as an example.
SED: In the sermon today, your priest expounded on the sin of greed, and how no greedy [Root.GetManWoman] can enter heaven. You just wish he didnt use yourself as an example.

SWMH: He's not wrong...
SED: Hes not wrong

EMF: A recent opportunity to improve the facilities in [Root.Capital.GetName] for assisting the poor has arisen, and it is something your councillors tell you will not only assist the people but make the city far better than it has ever been. It does, however, require a significant investment.
SWMH: A recent opportunity to improve the facilities in [Root.Capital.GetName] for assisting the poor has arisen, and it is something your councillors tell you will not only assist the people but make the city far better than it has ever been. It does, however, require a significant investment.
SED: A recent opportunity to improve the facilities in [Root.Capital.GetName] for assisting the poor has arisen, and it is something your councillors tell you will not only assist the people but make the city far better than it has ever been. It does, however, require a significant investment.

SWMH: Then we must do it
SED: Then we must do it

SWMH: We cannot afford it
SED: We cannot afford it

EMF: The ideals of the Waldensian faith have made a big impression on you. You have decided to be charitable at all times.
SWMH: The ideals of the Waldensian faith have made a big impression on you. You have decided to be charitable at all times.
SED: The ideals of the Waldensian faith have made a big impression on you. You have decided to be charitable at all times.

SWMH: The poor need our help!
SED: The poor need our help!

EMF: Messalians believe everyone is born with demons inside them, and those demons can only be expelled by intercession of the Holy Spirit...which can only be summoned with intense asceticism and prayer. It may take years to finally succeed, but you are ready to begin.
SWMH: Messalians believe everyone is born with demons inside them, and those demons can only be expelled by intercession of the Holy Spirit...which can only be summoned with intense asceticism and prayer. It may take years to finally succeed, but you are ready to begin.
SED: Messalians believe everyone is born with demons inside them, and those demons can only be expelled by intercession of the Holy Spirit which can only be summoned with intense asceticism and prayer. It may take years to finally succeed, but you are ready to begin.

EMF: Let the demons be driven out, once and for all!
SWMH: Let the demons be driven out, once and for all!
SED: Let the demons be driven out, once and for all!

EMF: You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but despite all your efforts you are still haunted by the sins of the flesh. You are forced to give up in defeat.
SWMH: You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but despite all your efforts you are still haunted by the sins of the flesh. You are forced to give up in defeat.
SED: You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but despite all your efforts you are still haunted by the sins of the flesh. You are forced to give up in defeat.

EMF: You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but in the end you are forced to admit your mind is still not your own. If anything, the spells of lunacy have become worse as weakness and dizziness beset you, and there are nights were you wander through the castle, howling. The demons are too strong, and you are forced to admit defeat.
SWMH: You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but in the end you are forced to admit your mind is still not your own. If anything, the spells of lunacy have become worse as weakness and dizziness beset you, and there are nights were you wander through the castle, howling. The demons are too strong, and you are forced to admit defeat.
SED: You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but in the end you are forced to admit your mind is still not your own. If anything, the spells of lunacy have become worse as weakness and dizziness beset you, and there are nights were you wander through the castle, howling. The demons are too strong, and you are forced to admit defeat.

EMF: You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but in the end you are forced to admit your mind is still not your own. In fact, the visions come more frequently, now. Lucifer himself has been speaking with you, whispering of your lamentable weakness...and you have to admit you agree. The demons within you are simply too strong.
SWMH: You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but in the end you are forced to admit your mind is still not your own. In fact, the visions come more frequently, now. Lucifer himself has been speaking with you, whispering of your lamentable weakness...and you have to admit you agree. The demons within you are simply too strong.
SED: You have prayed and fasted for months on end, but in the end you are forced to admit your mind is still not your own. In fact, the visions come more frequently, now. Lucifer himself has been speaking with you, whispering of your lamentable weakness and you have to admit you agree. The demons within you are simply too strong.

EMF: I will try again, I swear it!
SWMH: I will try again, I swear it!
SED: I will try again, I swear it!

EMF: It has taken many, many months of prayer and cold baths, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Luxuria from your soul.
SWMH: It has taken many, many months of prayer and cold baths, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Luxuria from your soul.
SED: It has taken many, many months of prayer and cold baths, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Luxuria from your soul.

EMF: It has taken many, many months of prayer and painful dedication, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Gula from your soul.
SWMH: It has taken many, many months of prayer and painful dedication, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Gula from your soul.
SED: It has taken many, many months of prayer and painful dedication, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Gula from your soul.

EMF: It has taken many, many months of prayer and many painful donations to the poor, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Avaritia from your soul.
SWMH: It has taken many, many months of prayer and many painful donations to the poor, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Avaritia from your soul.
SED: It has taken many, many months of prayer and many painful donations to the poor, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Avaritia from your soul.

EMF: It has taken many, many months of prayer and far too many early morning exercises, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Acedia from your soul.
SWMH: It has taken many, many months of prayer and far too many early morning exercises, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Acedia from your soul.
SED: It has taken many, many months of prayer and far too many early morning exercises, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Acedia from your soul.

EMF: It has taken many, many months of prayer and more slow counts to ten than you can even recall, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Ira from your soul.
SWMH: It has taken many, many months of prayer and more slow counts to ten than you can even recall, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Ira from your soul.
SED: It has taken many, many months of prayer and more slow counts to ten than you can even recall, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Ira from your soul.

EMF: It has taken many, many months of prayer and a great deal of contemplative meditation, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Invidia from your soul.
SWMH: It has taken many, many months of prayer and a great deal of contemplative meditation, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Invidia from your soul.
SED: It has taken many, many months of prayer and a great deal of contemplative meditation, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Invidia from your soul.

EMF: It has taken many, many months of prayer and a great deal of contemplative meditation, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Superbia from your soul.
SWMH: It has taken many, many months of prayer and a great deal of contemplative meditation, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Superbia from your soul.
SED: It has taken many, many months of prayer and a great deal of contemplative meditation, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Superbia from your soul.

EMF: It has taken many, many months of prayer and far too many visits to the local orphanage, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Cruelty from your soul.
SWMH: It has taken many, many months of prayer and far too many visits to the local orphanage, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Cruelty from your soul.
SED: It has taken many, many months of prayer and far too many visits to the local orphanage, but you have finally succeeded in driving the daemon of Cruelty from your soul.

EMF: You almost thought this day would never come. After many, many months of prayer and meditation, you wake up one morning and...the voices in your head are simply gone. You cannot even remember a time when you felt so in control of yourself. The demon in your mind has finally been driven out!
SWMH: You almost thought this day would never come. After many, many months of prayer and meditation, you wake up one morning and...the voices in your head are simply gone. You cannot even remember a time when you felt so in control of yourself. The demon in your mind has finally been driven out!
SED: You almost thought this day would never come. After many, many months of prayer and meditation, you wake up one morning and the voices in your head are simply gone. You cannot even remember a time when you felt so in control of yourself. The demon in your mind has finally been driven out!

EMF: You almost thought this day would never come. After many, many months of prayer and meditation, you wake up one morning and...your mind is simply your own. No more irrational impulses, no more dangerous thoughts. It is as if they simply never were. You cannot even remember a time when you felt so in control of yourself. The demon in your mind has finally been driven out!
SWMH: You almost thought this day would never come. After many, many months of prayer and meditation, you wake up one morning and...your mind is simply your own. No more irrational impulses, no more dangerous thoughts. It is as if they simply never were. You cannot even remember a time when you felt so in control of yourself. The demon in your mind has finally been driven out!
SED: You almost thought this day would never come. After many, many months of prayer and meditation, you wake up one morning and your mind is simply your own. No more irrational impulses, no more dangerous thoughts. It is as if they simply never were. You cannot even remember a time when you felt so in control of yourself. The demon in your mind has finally been driven out!

SWMH: Finally, I am free!
SED: Finally, I am free!

EMF: Since you are no longer Messalian, there is no point in continuing the prayer and fasting. There are no demons within you to cast out.
SWMH: Since you are no longer Messalian, there is no point in continuing the prayer and fasting. There are no demons within you to cast out.
SED: Since you are no longer Messalian, there is no point in continuing the prayer and fasting. There are no demons within you to cast out.

EMF: While you would happily continue your ritual prayer and fasting, it is simply not possible to do so while you are imprisoned.
SWMH: While you would happily continue your ritual prayer and fasting, it is simply not possible to do so while you are imprisoned.
SED: While you would happily continue your ritual prayer and fasting, it is simply not possible to do so while you are imprisoned.

EMF: While you would happily continue your ritual prayer and fasting, such rigorousness is now simply beyond your capacity.
SWMH: While you would happily continue your ritual prayer and fasting, such rigorousness is now simply beyond your capacity.
SED: While you would happily continue your ritual prayer and fasting, such rigorousness is now simply beyond your capacity.

EMF: Despite your prayers, you are still haunted by lustful dreams at night. The craving for carnal pleasures feels as if it will overwhelm you at times. The demon within may be too strong for you to expel.
SWMH: Despite your prayers, you are still haunted by lustful dreams at night. The craving for carnal pleasures feels as if it will overwhelm you at times. The demon within may be too strong for you to expel.
SED: Despite your prayers, you are still haunted by lustful dreams at night. The craving for carnal pleasures feels as if it will overwhelm you at times. The demon within may be too strong for you to expel.

EMF: I will surround myself with those of my own gender, no-one else!
SWMH: I will surround myself with those of my own gender, no-one else!
SED: I will surround myself with those of my own sex, no-one else!

SWMH: I cannot resist the temptation
SED: I cannot resist the temptation

EMF: The bold contours and muscles of the young men of your court are becoming irresistible. You realize you've been spending your days idly dreaming of their strong, oiled arms...
SWMH: The bold contours and muscles of the young men of your court are becoming irresistible. You realize you've been spending your days idly dreaming of their strong, oiled arms...
SED: The bold contours and muscles of the young men of your court are becoming irresistible. You realize youve been spending your days idly dreaming of their strong, oiled arms

EMF: The soft scents of the young women of your court are becoming overpowering. A nice warm bath sounds nice, where you can can massage oil into one or two of their young, nubile bodies...
SWMH: The soft scents of the young women of your court are becoming overpowering. A nice warm bath sounds nice, where you can can massage oil into one or two of their young, nubile bodies...
SED: The soft scents of the young women of your court are becoming overpowering. A nice warm bath sounds nice, where you can can massage oil into one or two of their young, nubile bodies

SWMH: I must resist temptation!
SED: I must resist temptation!

EMF: I have no choice but to give in...
SWMH: I have no choice but to give in...
SED: I have no choice but to give in

EMF: You have never felt this hungry in your life. You think of all the food stored in your kitchens. All the prayer in the world won't help if you starve to death...
SWMH: You have never felt this hungry in your life. You think of all the food stored in your kitchens. All the prayer in the world won't help if you starve to death...
SED: You have never felt this hungry in your life. You think of all the food stored in your kitchens. All the prayer in the world wont help if you starve to death

EMF: I cannot surrender to the sins of the flesh!
SWMH: I cannot surrender to the sins of the flesh!
SED: I cannot surrender to the sins of the flesh!

EMF: The sound of rattling dice draws you toward a pair of guardsmen, gambling for silver. It just so happens you have a set of loaded dice in your pocket, given to you from a friend in jest. Should you teach these fools a lesson?
SWMH: The sound of rattling dice draws you toward a pair of guardsmen, gambling for silver. It just so happens you have a set of loaded dice in your pocket, given to you from a friend in jest. Should you teach these fools a lesson?
SED: The sound of rattling dice draws you toward a pair of guardsmen, gambling for silver. It just so happens you have a set of loaded dice in your pocket, given to you from a friend in jest. Should you teach these fools a lesson?

EMF: No, gambling is sinful and greedy
SWMH: No, gambling is sinful and greedy
SED: No, gambling is sinful and greedy

EMF: Perhaps just a few games won't hurt...
SWMH: Perhaps just a few games won't hurt...
SED: Perhaps just a few games wont hurt

EMF: You haven't been keeping up on your prayers to expel the daemon of Sloth, which, beyond the irony of the situation, has been troubling you...
SWMH: You haven't been keeping up on your prayers to expel the daemon of Sloth, which, beyond the irony of the situation, has been troubling you...
SED: You havent been keeping up on your prayers to expel the daemon of Sloth, which, beyond the irony of the situation, has been troubling you

EMF: I will make a determined effort
SWMH: I will make a determined effort
SED: I will make a determined effort

EMF: The prayers can wait until tomorrow
SWMH: The prayers can wait until tomorrow
SED: The prayers can wait until tomorrow

EMF: A particularly irritating courtier has been on your nerves of late, when you happened to spot him prancing around with the most ridiculous hat on, causing your blood to boil.
SWMH: A particularly irritating courtier has been on your nerves of late, when you happened to spot him prancing around with the most ridiculous hat on, causing your blood to boil.
SED: A particularly irritating courtier has been on your nerves of late, when you happened to spot him prancing around with the most ridiculous hat on, causing your blood to boil.

SWMH: Slowly count to ten...
SED: Slowly count to ten

EMF: Have that hat nailed to his head
SWMH: Have that hat nailed to his head
SED: Have that hat nailed to his head

EMF: Your attempts to pray your envy away have been difficult. Lately, you have begun coveting a fine horse possessed by one of your courtiers, one who has been the pride of all [Root.Capital.GetName]. It would be so simple a matter for you to just take it for yourself. What could he do?
SWMH: Your attempts to pray your envy away have been difficult. Lately, you have begun coveting a fine horse possessed by one of your courtiers, one who has been the pride of all [Root.Capital.GetName]. It would be so simple a matter for you to just take it for yourself. What could he do?
SED: Your attempts to pray your envy away have been difficult. Lately, you have begun coveting a fine horse possessed by one of your courtiers, one who has been the pride of all [Root.Capital.GetName]. It would be so simple a matter for you to just take it for yourself. What could he do?

EMF: I can do without another horse
SWMH: I can do without another horse
SED: I can do without another horse

SWMH: It is rightfully mine, anyhow
SED: It is rightfully mine, anyhow

EMF: Your prayers to end your pride have not been successful. However, a young member of your church has proven himself skilled at exorcisms. Do you own up and ask for his assistance?
SWMH: Your prayers to end your pride have not been successful. However, a young member of your church has proven himself skilled at exorcisms. Do you own up and ask for his assistance?
SED: Your prayers to end your pride have not been successful. However, a young member of your church has proven himself skilled at exorcisms. Do you own up and ask for his assistance?

SWMH: Humbly ask him for help
SED: Humbly ask him for help

EMF: No, that's ridiculous! What could he do?
SWMH: No, that's ridiculous! What could he do?
SED: No, thats ridiculous! What could he do?

EMF: A criminal is brought before you for justice, having been caught stealing a small breakfast roll from the market. Although you have been trying to end your cruel inclinations, letting this man go will reflect poorly on you...you do have a reputation to uphold, after all.
SWMH: A criminal is brought before you for justice, having been caught stealing a small breakfast roll from the market. Although you have been trying to end your cruel inclinations, letting this man go will reflect poorly on you...you do have a reputation to uphold, after all.
SED: A criminal is brought before you for justice, having been caught stealing a small breakfast roll from the market. Although you have been trying to end your cruel inclinations, letting this man go will reflect poorly on you you do have a reputation to uphold, after all.

SWMH: Let him go free
SED: Let him go free

SWMH: Hang him as he deserves!
SED: Hang him as he deserves!

EMF: Choose a patron saint to watch over you and to who you will direct your prayers.
SWMH: Choose a patron saint to watch over you and to who you will direct your prayers.
SED: Choose a patron saint to watch over you and to who you will direct your prayers.

SWMH: St. Nestorius, the Evangelist
SED: St. Nestorius, the Evangelist

SWMH: St. Addai, disciple and healer
SED: St. Addai, disciple and healer

EMF: Lucifer, the greatest of the Archangels
SWMH: Lucifer, the greatest of the Archangels
SED: Lucifer, the greatest of the Archangels

EMF: St. Adelphius, the founder of the Faith
SWMH: St. Adelphius, the founder of the Faith
SED: St. Adelphius, the founder of the Faith

EMF: In a dark cellar, at the stroke of midnight, you take the oath. Surrounded by pentagrams, ram skulls and strange inscriptions written in no modern tongue, you swear to keep and preserve the secrets of Cult, and to die before revealing any of them. There, you learn the secret Truths of Heaven and Hell, passed down from Adelphius himself...

SWMH: Better to reign in Hell...
SED: Better to reign in Hell

SWMH: The Army of Lucifer
SED: The Army of Lucifer

EMF: The growing power of the Messalians can no longer be denied. With the aid of [Root.GetTitledName], a group of fanatics, peasants, and madmen have now banded together to create their own army -- one that has, much to the shock of Christians elsewhere in the world, taken as its patron saint none other than Lucifer the Lightbringer, greatest of the Archangels and the King of Hell. Lucifer, they believe, is no more than an agent of chaos and change, and in His name they intend to bring about a change in the world. They will drive the demons of sin from the ranks of humanity with the force of their arms...if they are given the chance, that is.

They will drive the demons of sin from the ranks of humanity with the force of their arms...if they are given the chance, that is.

Yours in faith,

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

EMF:
My [Root.GetLordLady],
I have thought long and hard about this, and I believe I have come to the conclusion that I must dedicate my life utterly to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. With your permission, I wish to join a monastery, though of course I will be available at court, should you need me.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

SWMH: The Order of Saint Blaise
SED: The Order of Saint Blaise

EMF: In order the stem the tide of infidels and heretics bearing down upon the innocent faithful, a small army of Armenian soldiers and clerics have banded together under the banner of Saint Blaise. With the Latins and Greeks pushing from the west and the Muslims from the East, there is very little these men have aside from unshakeable faith in the power of God to stand between them and their enemies.

SWMH: Knights of true Christendom!
SED: Knights of true Christendom!

SWMH: The Knights of Saint Mark
SED: The Knights of Saint Mark

EMF: In order the protect the oppressed faithful from the iron scepter of Muslim domination and the encroachment of the schismatics, the Knights of Saint Mark has arisen to preserve the Coptic populations scattered throughout Egypt and Abyssinia. Tales abound of their courage and tenacity, even against innumerably greater odds.

EMF: The growing power of Lollardy has led it to organize itself as a reflection of the Catholic Church. Created through the political will of [From.GetBestName], this new Church has a leader: [new_lollard_primate.GetTitledName], elected at a special gathering of bishops in [From.Capital.GetName]. The Lollard world rejoices at the news!

SWMH: The Waldensian Church
SED: The Waldensian Church

EMF: [Root.GetTitledName] has claimed the title of Waldensian Primate, head of all Christians who follow the teachings of Pierre Valdes and reject the greed and decadence of the Catholic Church. Others outside of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] claim the [Root.GetManWoman] is little more than a glorified scholar, but to the Waldensian faithful [Root.GetSheHe] is a symbol of their victory against ignorance and attempts by their fellow Christians to suppress them. Perhaps, in time, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will lead the Waldensians to claiming a piece of history in Europe.

SED: The [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] Conclave

EMF: The [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] faith is considered heretical, but it would be foolish to ignore their growing power. A prominent [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] ruler by the name of [sponsor.GetTitledName] has called for a conclave in [sponsor.Capital.GetName] where [heretic_relhead.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and [parent_relhead.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] can meet and discuss whether a peaceful resolution of their differences is possible.

EMF: In an unprecedented show of tolerance and diplomacy, [parent_relhead.GetTitledName] has agreed to a truce with [heretic_relhead.GetTitledName] and indeed the entire [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] faith after a historic meeting in [sponsor.Capital.GetName]. The [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName]s will now be considered an offshoot of the [parent_relhead.Religion.GetName] religion, their differences a permanent schism, rather than a heresy which must be suppressed and stamped out. [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] faithful across all of Europe have risen up in celebration of this momentous day.

EMF: A historic meeting in [sponsor.Capital.GetName] between [heretic_relhead.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and [parent_relhead.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has ended in disaster. It was clear from the outset that [parent_relhead.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] was ready to compromise on none of the [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] points of discussion, and eventually [parent_relhead.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] left the conclave in disgust. [parent_relhead.GetSheHeCap] shortly afterwards called for a holy war against the [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName]s by all [parent_relhead.Religion.GetName] faithful to reclaim their souls for [parent_relhead.Religion.GetHighGodName].

SWMH: Acheiropoieta
SED: Acheiropoieta

EMF: Above the gate to a city in [acheiropoieta_province.GetName], there is enshrined an Acheiropoieta: an icon which, it is claimed, was not created by human hands but rather came into existence miraculously. All icons in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are condemned to be destroyed, but the people of [acheiropoieta_province.GetName] have refused to destroy the Acheiropoieta, claiming its divine heritage shelters the city from danger. [iconoclast_patriarch.GetTitledName] has, however, demanded you deal it regardless.

SWMH: Constantine's Return
SED: Constantines Return

EMF: The war is not going well, and many parts of the empire are already in chaos. Now, a group of soldiers has reportedly broken into the imperial mausoleum in the Church of the Holy Apostles, opened the sarcophagus of Constantine V, and implored him to return and save the empire. Iconoclast zealots have been quick to jump on this news, claiming it is Orthodox idolatry that is dooming the emperor. They have pleaded with [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to honor the memory of the former emperor and lead the emperor away from its idolatrous ways before it is too late.

He has spread his sect throughout Armenian lands ruled by the Byzantine Empire, and is very quickly becoming a major problem for Orthodox rulers.

SWMH: This is an outrage!

SWMH: The Paulician Patriarch
SED: The Paulician Patriarch

EMF: [Root.GetTitledName] has claimed the title of Paulician Patriarch, head of all Christians who follow the teachings of Paul of Samosata. Others outside of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] claim the [Root.GetManWoman] is little more than a glorified warlord, but to the Paulician faithful [Root.GetSheHe] is a symbol of their victory against attempts by their fellow Christians to suppress them. Perhaps, in time, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will lead the Paulicians to claiming a piece of history in Europe.

SWMH: Bogomilists in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]

EMF: A heresiarch by the name of 'Bogomil', which may not even be his true name, has appeared in the province of Kossovo, capitalizing on the anger of the locals following their conversion from pagan ways. His teachings of a heresy that seems to combine Christianity with a combination of Gnostic dualism and anti-church sentiment has caught on extremely quickly in both Kossovo and the surrounding areas, presenting a challenge to [Root.GetTitledName]'s rule as well as to the authority of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. Some believe that this 'Bogomil' has reached the court of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], and that [Root.GetSheHe] might even be considered a conversion to these heretical beliefs.

EMF: The formalization process of Bogomilism has officially begun, with [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] meeting with a group of perfecti leaders in [Root.Capital.GetName] and expressing [Root.GetHerHis] desire to see the faith go from a disorganized movement to one fully integrated with [Root.GetHerHis] rule. They expressed doubt, but were willing to hear [Root.GetHerHim] out, for the time being.

EMF: All this talk of 'reforming' the Bogomilist faith in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is pointless. Perhaps the previous rulers were interested in such a thing, but since you are not a Bogomilist, you will certainly have no part in it.

EMF: [Root.GetTitledName]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the Bogomilist faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have been rewarded after a recent meeting of Perfecti in [Root.Capital.GetName]. They finally agreed to a common liturgy, so that ceremonies performed across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] use a common set of prayers and rituals, and that this will be taught to new Perfecti going forward.

EMF: Up until now, Bogomilist priests have all used different letters and gospels in their preaching, a result of the scattered and disparate beginnings of the faith. At the behest of [Root.GetTitledName], the '[Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] Bible' has been written and agred upon as canon by a council of Perfecti in [Root.Capital.GetName].

EMF: In order to continue the process of formalizing the Bogomilist faith, the scattered preachers and Perfecti will need to be gathered together in councils. They resist such efforts an organization, however, and the only way to see it done will be with coin -- for the poor, for shrines, for bribes, and for God.

Indeed, some are viewing the text as a new addition to Bogomilist canon.

EMF: Recently, a new sect of Bogomilist has been spreading in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], one that advocates a radically different version of the faith. Normally this would not be an issue, as the sect is not popular, but it has proven disruptive to your efforts to formalize Bogomilism, as their presence has prompted other sects to follow suit.

SED: Quietly get rid of them

EMF: A recent revival of Bogomilist traditionalism has taken hold in [PrimaryTitle.GetName], with numerous preachers cropping up who actively deride your efforts to reform the faith as being exactly the same sort of tyrannical structure they rebelled against in the first place. Needless to say, this has not been helpful.

EMF: A prominent Perfecti in [demand_province.GetName] has publicly begged that you slow down, if not outright stop, the process of Bogomilist reform. The common folk are confused by these contradictions, he says, and continuing down this path too quickly will only bring down God's wrath. The Perfecti is too popular to be silenced, as doing so would turn him into a martyr for his cause.

They say that you are to blame, that your desire for reforms and general lack of piety is what has brought down God's wrath upon the people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Sadly, their words have taken hold amongst many.

To her, you are not a learned enough [Root.GetManWoman] to push such things forward, and there is no convincing her otherwise.

SWMH: Bogomilist Faith Organized
SED: Bogomil Faith Organized

EMF: In its inception, the Bogomilist faith was only loosely organized. It didn't believe in formal churches, and opposed any kind of formal hierarchy -- this has all changed with the leadership of [Root.GetTitledName], whose piety and status as a Perfecti has encouraged all members of [Root.GetHerHis] faith to reconsider their resistance to feudal structures. Bogomilists across the world are now more formally organized, though many still do not consider them a true religion, and they remain opposed to any kind of formal church that emulates the Orthodox priesthood. Even so, there are many that object to even these changes, saying that Bogomilism has betrayed its own roots at a powerful [Root.GetLordLady]'s behest.

Even so, there are many that object to even these changes, saying that Bogomilism has betrayed its own roots at a powerful [Root.GetLordLady]'s behest.

EMF: A better day for us all

SWMH: Bogomilist Faith Formalized
SED: Bogomil Faith Formalized

EMF: Though the faithful were hardly ready for it, Bogomilism has now been formalized as a structured religion thanks to the leadership of [Root.GetTitledName]. While many see [Root.GetHerHis] leadership and piety as being worthwhile to follow, there are many who claim [Root.GetSheHe] has dragged the faith too fast into something which too much resembles the very kind of tyrannical structures they once abandoned. Preachers throughout [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are questioning how far this will go, and whether the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] has not perhaps betrayed Bogomilism's principles for the sake of power. Whatever the case, Bogomilist priests are now unified under a common liturgy, a single sacred text, and operate out of temples -- far more than the disparate heretics from where they sprang.

EMF: This is how it must be

EMF: Are we truly ready for this?
SWMH: Are we truly ready for this?
SED: Are we truly ready for this?

EMF: After a long and arduous process of reform, the Bogomilist faith can now truly be considered a formal religion. Under the considered leadership and piety of [Root.GetTitledName], Bogomilist priests are now unified under a common liturgy, a single sacred text, and operate out of temples -- far more than the disparate heretics from where they sprang. While some question whether these reforms betray the principles upon which Bogomilism was founded, far more say they were agreed to by all and with due consideration. The faith is now ready to come into its own.

SWMH: The Bogomilist Patriarchy
SED: The Bogomil Patriarchy

EMF: At the behest of [Root.GetTitledName], [new_bogomilist_patriarch.GetTitledName] has been elected as the head of the newly-founded Bogomilist Church, Bogomilism having completely transformed itself from an Orthodox heresy into a fully-formed religion in its own right. Christian leaders elsewhere have been forced to recognize this new faith as a force in its own right, and its inception as a schism from standard Christianity rather than a true heresy.

Christian leaders elsewhere have been forced to recognize this new faith as a force in its own right, and its inception as a schism from standard Christianity rather than a true heresy.

EMF: The rain has been pouring down for days, it's almost impossible to travel the roads. Why does [Root.GetHighGodName] punish His faithful pilgrims so?

SWMH: [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] is showing me the way
SED: [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] is showing me the way
VANILLA: The Lord is showing me the way.

EMF: As you walk around on this holy ground, you ponder the secrets and the essence of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. The teachings of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith have never felt more relevant to you than right now. Imagine the knowledge contained in the scriptures stored here!
SWMH: As you walk around on this holy ground, you ponder the secrets and the essence of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]. The teachings of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith have never felt more relevant to you than right now. Imagine the knowledge contained in the scriptures stored here!

EMF: The way to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] is through study.
SWMH: The way to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] is through study.
SED: The way to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] is through study.
VANILLA: The way to Heaven is through study.

EMF: The scriptures, the buildings, this holy ground, how it all moves my soul! I realize now that all my life up to this point has only been a preparation for this journey. How wondrous that the light of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] truly shines in me, a humble servant. From now on I shall always do His work.

EMF: The stories of other pilgrims all spoke of how impressive this place is. Now that you can see it with your own eyes, you can only join in their praise. You are glad that you came here, to one of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith's most holy places.
SWMH: The stories of other pilgrims all spoke of how impressive this place is. Now that you can see it with your own eyes, you can only join in their praise. You are glad that you came here, to one of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith's most holy places.

EMF: Near the holy sites, you hear rumors of a group of [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle]s with strange cures for diseases. Eagerly, you seek them out, hoping against hope that they may aid you. Once in their care you are fed strange potions, foods and herbs. You are unconscious or delirious during most of the process and remember few details, but at last you wake up to find that you have been miraculously healed of your ills.
